Madinakhon spent all of her money this month for family needs and was left without money, and unable to purchase merchandise for the next month.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 US dollars to purchase food products, such as bread, butter, canned goods, candy, pasta and the like.  She relies on your kindness very much.

loans.use: to purchase food products, such as bread, butter, canned goods, candy, pasta and the like

loans.name: Yudy Angelina

texts.es:
Su nombre es Yudy, es hija de un empleado y ama de casa, ella es la tercera de una hermana y un hermano, tuvo una infancia feliz y destaco en el colegio.
Aunque sus padres se separaron, estudio todo su secundaria  en el colegio.
Estudio Secretaria Empresarial, hizo cursos de  Bisutería, Emprendimiento en el luego por su trabajo que era de domingo a domingo no tenía tiempo de estudiar y dejo pasar mucho tiempo, hasta que tomo la decisión de cambiar su trabajo por uno de medio tiempo para sí volver a retomar sus estudios. Para ella  es  muy importante actualizarse y aprender puesto que la tecnología cada día va más avanzada. Que es muy importante aprender de la contabilidad personal y empresarial para si en un futuro saber que decisiones debe tomar en su vida financiera.
Actualmente está estudiando en la corporación las mercedes en VI semestre de técnico profesional en contabilidad financiera. 
Ella aunque ha tenido obstáculos  a seguido adelante, unos de sus objetivos es graduarse con mucho orgullo, para sí dejar una gran huella en el mundo aportándole sus conocimientos y creatividad como profesional financiera en una multinacional. 
Yudy es  trabajadora, alegre, inteligente, creativa, compañerista, se acopla a los cambios, corrige y aprende de sus errores, Ella no solo quiere demostrarle a su familia y a la sociedad que nunca pero nunca es tarde para estudiar, más ahora que hay  instituciones universitarias  que dan  facilidades de pago e  identidades que obsequian subsidios para estudiar.
Aunque dicen, que si no agarran las oportunidades que pasan en la vida no volverán a pasar y no es cierto Dios vuelve a enviar oportunidades y muchos más grandes de las cuales uno las agarra con más seguridad y sin medio.
Yudy después que se gradúe como técnica profesional,  quiere seguir estudiando en la universidad como contadora pública e inglés.
texts.en:
Yudy is the daughter of a worker and a housewife.  She's the third child and has one sister and one brother.  She had a happy childhood and stood out in school.  She completed secondary school even though her parents separated.

She took classes in secretarial studies, jewelry, and entrepreneurship.  Then, because she worked every day, she didn't have time to study.  She let a lot of time go by until she decided to change to a half-time job so she could return to her studies.

It's very important to her to bring herself up to date and learn, because technology is more advanced all the time.  It's very important to learn about personal and business accounting so in the future she knows what decisions to make in her financial life.

Currently she's in her sixth semester at Corporación Las Mercedes, studying to be a technical professional in financial accounting.  She has made progress despite having faced obstacles.  One of her goals is to graduate proudly so she can leave her mark on the world, contributing her knowledge and creativity as a financial professional in a multinational company.

Yudy is hardworking, happy, intelligent, creative, and collegial.  She adapts to change and corrects and learns from her errors.  She wants to show her family and society not only that it's never, ever too late to study, but also that now there are universities that offer payment terms and entities that grant subsidies for studying.

Although it is said that if you don't seize opportunities in life they won't come up again, it's not true.  God sends opportunities, and much bigger ones, that can be seized with greater certainty and without fear.

After she graduates as a professional, Yudy wants to continue studying public accounting and English in the university.

loans.use: to finish her program in financial accounting

loans.name: Om-Mohammed Group

texts.en:
Om-Mohammed group consists of 5 women from Sana`a, Yemen. They asked for a loan of 200,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to buy furniture.

Latifa is a 42-year-old married woman with two children. She can read and write. Her husband is very hard working and doing his best to earn money. However, he is unable to buy some furniture for their small house because what he earns is hardly enough to buy food and clothes. Latifa decided to help her husband and applied for a loan of 50,000 YER to buy a cupboard to use for their house. She hopes that their life conditions will improve and that they will find the capital to build the second floor of their house.

loans.use: to buy a cupboard for her house.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
This is Jose.  He and his wife are continuously working to meet their everyday needs.

His previous loan was a big help in his business.  He was able to buy more grocery items for his general store.  After six years in the business, he was able to attract loyal partners who buy his products and patronize his business.  

He would like to apply for another loan in the amount of 11,000 PHP that he would use to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory.  The more items displayed at the store the better.  More items to sell will result in better profit.  His profits from his business will definitely help him to meet their daily needs.  He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Jose dreams that his business will grow larger and that he will become a successful businessman.  He meets with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week.  At these meetings, he also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that he studies.

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages.

loans.name: Mirian Venessa

texts.es:
Mirian es madre soltera tiene dos hijos de 6 y 2 años, vive en Ventanas junto a su madre y los hijos en casa de la madre.

Mirian se dedica a la venta de ropa tiene un local en casa de la madre en donde compra la mercaderia en Guayaquil, el dinero lo va a utilizar para invertir en el negocio.

El sueño de Mirian es vender toda la mercaderia para tener dinero para comprar lo necesario para comer y dar la educacion a los hijos. En los tiempos libres le gusta leer libros de historias emocionantes.
texts.en:
Mirian is a single mother who has two children, aged six and two. She lives with her mother and children in her mother's home.

Mirian makes a living selling clothing. She has her business in her mother's home and buys the merchandise in Guayaquil. She will use the money to invest in this business. 

Mirian's dream is to sell all her merchandise so that she has money to buy all that is necessary to eat and offer her children education. In her free time she likes to read books filled with thrilling stories.

loans.use: to buy clothing for her business.

loans.name: Telma

texts.en:
This is Telma. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more tanks of LPG, thus generating more income. The income from the loan also helped in her household expenditures, as well as in the education of her children. She and her husband are working hard, to provide for their family's everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of 30,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy more tanks of LPG. Her profits from business will definitely help her to meet her family's daily needs and to pay the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Telma dreams of having her own sales stall, and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more tanks of LPG to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Dali

texts.en:
Dali is 58 years old. She lives alone in Sagarejo district. Dali requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected all the time because of low income and poor living conditions.

Dali’s only source of the income is from her trading business. She is purchasing clothes from the big market in the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi, and selling them at the local market where she rents a counter. Even though she is selling the clothes herself, the profit is still very small as the expenses are high and it’s very hard for her to cover her monthly expenses.

Dali requested loan from Credo to start a family business. Dali has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit Dali will purchase a car. She wants to start trading vegetables. In front of her house Dali has a small space to put the counter and trade vegetables. She will purchase the products from the big market in the capital city at the wholesale price and sell them with the price marked up to earn additional income. 

Dali will use part of her profits for reinvesting and expanding her business, and the other part to cover her monthly expenses and have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a car and start trading vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy baskets full of dried fish to add to her current stock for sale.

loans.name: Erlin Marixsa

texts.es:
Erlin, tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija y vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara con su hija y su madre.
Erlin tiene 4 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de pan casero como pastelitos, semitas, bollos, quesadia y otros. El pan lo vende en la comunidad donde tiene sus clientes. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo que es por 15,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar insumos como azucar, harina, huevos, leche, manteca y otros para elaborar el pan y poder aumentar las ventas. Su objetivo es poder ubicar el negocio en un local fijo y darle una mejor vida a su hija.
texts.en:
Erlin, 30, is a single mother; she has one child and lives in the town of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara with her daughter and her mother.  

Erlin has been baking home-made bread like little cakes, buns, rolls, cheese bread and others, for four years.  She sells the bread in her community which is where her customers are.  

She’s requesting her second loan for 15,000 Lempiras she’ll use to buy ingredients like sugar, flour, eggs, milk and shortening and others to bake bread and be able to increase her sales.  Her goal is to be able to install her business in a fixed locale and to give her daughter a better life.

loans.use: to buy baking supplies.

loans.name: The Tamarrneh United Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the The Tamarrneh United Group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 1,300,000 SLL each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their respective businesses, increase their sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Abibatu is the featured leader of this group. The 35-year-old is married to a trader and they have 2 children who are attending primary school. Abibatu has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells slippers/flip-flops. With her share of this loan, she will buy slippers/flip-flops in large quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy slippers/flip-flops in large quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fruit to support her husband's fruit selling business.

loans.name: Potoru Women Group

texts.en:
Jassie is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Kenema city, about 29 years ago. She is married to a driver, and the couple has two children. One is attending primary school, and the other is in secondary school. Jassie sells fresh fish, a business she has been doing for many years, now.

With the help of this loan, Jassie and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and, consequently, improve their living conditions. Jassie will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy cartons of fresh fish to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy cartons of fresh fish to add to her current stock

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Alfredo en su negocio de venta de almuerzos, pues con su credikiva logró aumentar su producción porque compró materias primas e insumos con los que preparó ricos alimentos que vendió. Él pudo captar más clientes y aumentar su bienestar personal. Alfredo dice a los financiadores de Kiva “Gracias por el apoyos y que siga ayudándonos. “ Actualmente está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el que comprará carnes, aves,en mayor volumen, con el cual  planea incrementar su producción y continuar aumentando sus ventas, haciendo de esta inversión todo un éxito.
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Alfredo and his lunches selling activity. Thanks to his loan he has succeeded in increasing his production by buying basic ingredients he has used to prepare the tasty food he sells. He has been able to gain more customers and to increase his personal wellbeing. This is what Alfredo says to Kiva lenders: “Thank you for your support, and I hope you’ll keep on helping us”. He is currently requesting a new loan that he will use to buy meat and chickens in bigger quantities, as he plans on boosting his production and in continue increasing his sales, thus making a good profit out of this investment.

loans.use: To buy meat and chickens.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: El Sr. Reynaldo  tiene  29 años casado, tiene dos hijos de las edades de 5 y 2 años, el se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura, siembra papa maíz, frijol, arroz  y yuca en su parcela que se encuentran en la localidad de Surutu,  el es cliente nuevo de la institución,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Reynaldo  va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de semillas y preparado de la tierra para la siembra de frijol y arroz y así de esta manera aumentar su producción,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de dinero para la época de siembra, El Sr. Reynaldo  enfrenta retos en su negocio que esta temporada de frio ya que en muchas ocasiones arruina la siembra y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is 29 years old and has two children, ages 5 and 2.  He is a farmer and raises potatoes, corn, beans, rice, and yucca on a parcel of land in Surutu.  He is new to the institution and this will be his first loan.

Reynaldo will use the money to buy seeds and to prepare the land to raise beans and rice and increase his production in this manner.  He is asking for this loan because he is short of capital for the planting season.  Reynaldo has challenges in his business since the cold season often ruins his crops and he wants to use the benefits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to prepare his farmland.

loans.name: Nerida

texts.es:
Nerida, de 49 años de edad es una mujer sencilla. Educó a sus 9 hijos, de los que en la actualidad solo 3 viven con ella en la casa que cuida de sus tíos.Desde las primeras horas del día se alista para trabajar en alguna festividad que exista en su localidad , pues la principal actividad económica que posee Nerida es la venta de comida en las festividades del valle. Menciona que le va muy bien en su negocio porque es una de las mejores cocineras de la zona, además lleva 20 años cocinando en toda clase de celebración que tiene cada año la ciudad. Es así que ahora desea mejorar sus ingresos económicos “Necesito renovar la carpa que poseo, además de ollas y demás utensilios”, afirma.Este es el primer crédito con KIVA, se siente feliz, pues tiene el capital necesario para mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida.
Nerida, invertirá los S/1500 soles en la compra de productos comestibles tales como arroz , carnes y verduras los cuales usa en la elaboración de sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Nerida is 49 years old and is modest and unassuming. She has raised nine children, three of whom still live with her in her uncle and aunt’s home that she cares for. From the first hours of the day, she gets ready to work in some festival that is taking place in her area, because her principal work is selling food in the festivals of her valley. She says that her business is going well for her because she is one of the best cooks in her area – and moreover, she has been cooking for 20 years now for all kinds of celebrations that take place each year in her city.

Nerida would now like to improve her income. “I need a new awning for my stall, as well as pots and more utensils,” she says. This is her first Kiva loan. She says she feels happy to have the capital she needs to improve her business and therefore her quality of life. She will use the 1500 PEN to buy groceries such as rice, meat and vegetables that she uses to make her dishes.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as rice, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en: Rhodora is 54 years old, married with three children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates an agricultural business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over nine years and earns 6,000 PHP every month. She has joined GDMPC to gain access to finance for her business. Now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fetilizer such as manure. Her hope and dream is to have a better future and improve her living situation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Marlito

texts.en:
This is Marlito. He previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that he used in the maintenance of his karaoke machine. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. He also has a variety store for additional income.

He would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan. He will be incorporating the loan for the maintenance of his karaoke machine and to buy grocery items for his variety store. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Marlito dreams that his business will continue to grow. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and work every week. This is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of his video/karaoke machine and to buy grocery items for his variety store.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Deborah works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. 

Deborah is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dry goods to sell for her business.

Deborah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Zulfiqar

texts.en: Zulfiqar is a hardworking 30-year-old man. He lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with his family. He is the father of 3 children. He has been running a small embroidery shop for 3 years. His embroidery items are liked by everyone. As his stock of embroidery material is almost finished at present he would like to purchase a new variety of embroidery materials including colorful threads, beads, stones, needles, lace and cloths. For that purpose Zulfiqar has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. He is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for his business. With the profit he earns he wants to construct his own house. He hopes that he will earn a sufficient profit so that he can easily pay back the loan amount as well as construct his own house. Zulfiqar feels very happy after taking the loan amount because this will help him to fulfill his needs.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery material.

loans.name: Tariq

texts.en:
Tariq is a 47-year-old, hardworking and diligent businessman. He lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with his wife, two daughters and one son. Since 1998, Tariq has been running a small general store to generate an income for his family. He has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to expand his business. He wants to buy a variety of goods like milk, sugar, rice, soap, detergents, creams, etc., and to introduce some new items for his general store in order to fulfill the demands of his customers and increase his savings. He will reinvest the profit in the general store and use a part of it to pay for household expenses and the education of the children. 

Tariq is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support. He is very hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods for his general store

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional fishing material for her fishing business. Leonora has been in this business for 15 years. She earns an additional income from raising pigs.

Leonora can be seen with her newly bought machine for her fishing business in the accompanying picture.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing material for her business.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is married and has three children.  Two of her children are still in school while the oldest child is already married.  Daisy and her husband work together to generate sufficient profit to provide for the needs of their family and to support the education of their children.  

Daisy has been running her videoke and video game business for 10 years.  She is thankful because, through her patience and hard work, she was able to generate better profit.  Now, she aspires to have more units of both video games and videoke in order for her business to grow.  For this to become reality, she is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP.  She will use this to buy a DVD player, a television controller, nails and plywood to be used in her videoke and video game business.  Daisy is hoping for the approval of her requested loan amount in order to assure the continuous smooth flow of her business and for it to become profitable.

loans.use: to buy a DVD player, a television controller, nails and plywood.

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en:
Margarit is a mom of two sons, living in Bazmaberd village, Aragatsotn region. Together with her husband, Margarit runs a little farm that includes two cows and 30 chickens. Their elder son, Zaqar (18 years old), studies at Yerevan State University and specializes in the department of history.

Because the farming business is the only source of her family's income, it is very difficult for Margarit to sustain the family's living and at the same time save money for Zaqar's education. So, Margarit has requested a loan from SEF International, in order to pay her son's university tuition. The loan is very important for Zaqar to be able to get a higher education and become a good specialist with a well-paid job.

loans.use: to pay university tuition for her son

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan es un agricultor que durante muchos años se ha dedicado a la agricultura, ya que esta es la principal actividad de la zona, sus productos los vende a centros de acopio locales, con los ingresos obtenidos sustenta a su familia compuesta por cinco miembros. El objetivo es crecer económicamente para que sus hijos puedan ir a la universidad y tengan un futuro mejor, para ello está solicitando un crédito por un millón de colones (1.000.000)con esto extenderá el área de siembra, comprará semilla de maíz y suministros para obtener nuevos ingresos a partir de la venta de la cosecha.
texts.en: Juan is a farmer who has worked in agriculture for many years, because this is the main activity in the area. He sells his products at local distribution centers. With his income, he sustains his family of five. His goal is to grow economically so that his children can go to university and have a better future. With this in mind, he is requesting a loan of one million colones (1 000 000). With this, he will extend his area of fertile land, buy corn seeds, and buy supplies in order to get new income from the sale of his harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds and supplies.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 16 years.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase spare parts and tools, for the maintenance of her pump-boat. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan, to further build her fishing business. Rufina would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and tools, for the maintenance of her pumpboat

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto's previous loan was a big help in his business, for he was able to buy all the needed grocery items for his variety store. It also helped in the education of his children. In this business for more than five years now, he and his wife work to continuously provide for their everyday expenses.

Ernesto is requesting a new loan for 20,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed in the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits, profits that will definitely help to sustain the family's daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Ernesto dreams that his business will grow bigger, and he hopes to give his children a good life and education. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Claudia Yesenia

texts.es:
Claudia, requiere de un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de seguir invirtiendo en el cultivo de granos básicos; este le permitirá comprar insumos agropecuarios tales como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, pesticidas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar sus ingresos y los está invirtiendo en mejoras de la vivienda; las condiciones económicas han mejorado, ya que los ingresos han aumentado y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Claudia is requesting a new loan as she needs to keep on investing in her basic grains crops; this will help her to buy farming supplies such as manure, weed-killers, insecticides, pest-control substances and pesticides among other items.
Her previous loan has helped her increase her income, which she is currently investing in making improvements to her house; her economic situation has progressed, as her earnings have increased and her family conditions have improved.

loans.use: To buy manure, weed-killers, insecticides, pest-control substances and pesticides.

loans.name: Lewnida

texts.en:
Lewnida is a 43-year-old mother from Kachok location in Kisumu City. She supports three people in her family. She is a widow who has three children in school and their ages are 22, 18 and 16 years old.

She operates a tree nursery, a business she has been doing for the last 10 years and makes a monthly income of KES 30,000. She is taking her fourth loan with KADET Ltd., which she will use to buy a water pump and other seedlings. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business and pay school fees.

She has a dream of improving her business so as to become stable and help her provide for her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy tree seedlings and a water pump.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock like Coca-Cola, Fanta and Sprite

loans.name: Exequila

texts.en:
Exequila is a 48-year-old married woman and mother of six children from Bohol, Philippines. She earns a living through her vegetable gardening business. 

Exequila is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and nylon for trellis-making. Through this, she will be able to improve her farm and increase the quality and quantity of her harvest. 

In the future, Exequila hopes to improve her farm in order to generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and nylon for trellis-making.

loans.name: Mohamed's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers in a technical vocation in the city of Kenema, in eastern Sierra Leone. This school was founded in 1994 by the Roman Catholic Mission to improve education in the community. Teachers of this institution have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to request a loan.

Mohamed is the featured leader of the group. Mohamed is age 31. He was born in Loppa Dama, in eastern Sierra Leone. Mohamed is married to a teacher and has three children, who are attending primary and secondary schools. He has been in the teaching profession for 12 years, now. Mohamed is going to invest his loan in a business. He will buy palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil) in large quantity, to sell in the local market. In this way, he will be able to generate additional income to supplement his monthly salary.

loans.use: to supplement his teaching salary, by buying palm oil to resell

loans.name: Eusebio Jr.

texts.en:
Eusebio Jr. is a married man and a father of two children from Loboc, Bohol. 

He is engaged in a car and motorcycle rental business. He also runs a sari-sari or variety store  business. This is the source of his income.

Eusebio Jr. is asking for a loan to pay for the repair and maintenance for the car and to buy stocks for the store like canned goods, candies, noodles, rice, and others. 

In the future, Eusebio Jr. hopes to make his business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fuel for the truck and stock for the store like canned goods, candies, noodles, rice, and others.

loans.name: Sinay's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Kampong Cham province, Sinay is 63 years old and a married mother of three kids. Her primary source of income is rice farming, while working for others for a fee is her extra income generating activity during her spare time. She has been involved in this job since she was 20 years old, and currently she is able to earn about 28,000 KHR per day. 

This is the second loan for Sinay with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loan already. She is now in a group of two to apply for a new loan. She is seeking 1,300,000 KHR while her co-borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. Sinay will spend her loan portion to plow her farmland and to buy potash for her farm. She hopes to gain multiple yields and make more income.

loans.use: To plow her farmland and to buy potash for her farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Yesenia Marleny

texts.es:
Yesenia tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos de 21, 17 y 15 años de edad. Ella se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa y al cuido de sus hijos. Ella se dedica a criar vacas desde hace 14 años y fue junto a su familia que aprendió. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar hierro y lamina para fabricar puertas y ventanas para su casa. Con la inversión ella y su familia se sentirán más seguras, cómodas y sin preocuparse mucho ya que la casa será asegurada al tener las puertas y ventanas.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 40 years old, she is married and she has three children aged 21, 17 and 15. She is a housewife, engaging in domestic chores and in caring for her children. She has also been engaging in breeding cows for 14 years, learning this activity from her family.

The loan she is requesting to Fundación Campo will be used to buy iron and steel sheets to make doors and windows for her house. Thanks to this investment her family and herself will feel safer, more comfortable and they will have no need to worry too much because the house will be secure with doors and windows.

loans.use: To buy iron and steel sheets.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi is a hardworking person, who strives hard to facilitate the survival of her family. She has operated a beauty salon for years. With the loan that she is asking for, she wants to buy more pedicure and manicure materials, and body lotions, necklaces, and hair braids to resell. She thanks Kiva and Yehu for their support.

loans.use: to buy more pedicure and manicure materials, and body lotions, necklaces, and hair braids to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase building materials, like cement, sand, corrugated zinc, and nails, for the construction of a house

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is 42 years old, married, and has six children. With three children currently in school, Monina works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional stock to resell at her store, like coffee, sugar, cream, milk, laundry soap, eggs and other groceries. In the future, Monina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to resell at her store, like coffee, sugar, cream, milk, laundry soap, eggs and other groceries

loans.name: Mayra Alejandra

texts.es:
Gracias por apoyar a Mayra en la ampliación de su negocio porque lo logró con su credikiva. Ahora tiene más mercancía disponible  para la venta. Desde que recibió su credikiva se incrementaron sus ventas y sus utilidades. Ella dice a los financiadores de Kiva: “Gracias por multiplicar esa ayuda a todos los empresarios de Colombia. “
En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva con el cual comprará ropa, calzado y artículos solicitados por sus clientes, para responder a su clientela y seguir haciendo exitosa la inversión de Kiva en su negocio.
texts.en:
Thank you for helping Mayra expand her activity, something she has achieved with here previous loan. She now has more products to sell, and both her sales and her profit have increase since she has received the loan. This is what she say to Kiva lenders: “Thank you for offering your support to all Colombian entrepreneurs”.
She is currently requesting a loan to buy clothes, shoes and items her customers have requested, in order to meet her customers’ needs and to keep on making Kiva’s inversion in her shop a success.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
JOSE tiene 33 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con en casa de los padres junto a ellos e Chimbo provincia de Bolívar.

José se dedica a realizar dulces tradicionales cómo colaciones, turrones, canguil de dulce. Solicita el crédito para comprar azúcar, papel, panela, un quintal de canguil, un cilindro de gas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para poder trabajar. El sueño es tener un capital para trabajar y comprar las cosas que necesaita sin ningún problema.
En el tiempo libre le gusta compartir con la familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 33 years old, single, and has no children. He lives with his parents in their house in Chimbo, Bolivar province.

Jose makes traditional sweets, including snacks, nougats, and sweet popcorn. He is requesting a loan to buy sugar, paper, brown sugar loafs, a hundred-weight of popcorn, and a cylinder of gas.  With the help of the loan, he will be able to purchase everything necessary to be able to work. His dream is to have the capital to continue working and to buy all necessary things without any problems.

Jose likes to spend his spare time with his family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, paper, brown sugar loaves, and a hundred-weight of popcorn for making sweets to sell.

loans.name: Pelaya

texts.es:
Pelaya tiene 62 años, está felizmente casada y vive en compañía de 3 de sus 6 hijos en la casa que heredó hace 37 años.Pelaya se siente muy feliz, pues toda su vida ha estado trabajando arduamente en las tareas agrícolas, sus años de experiencia en el cultivo de la tierra, le trae satisfacciones porque por más de 32 años ella supo junto a su esposo  sacar provecho a sus actividades y sus 6 hijos que en su mayoría son hombres y mujeres de bien  han sido sostenidos económicamente con está importante fuente de ingresos, en la actualidad se dedica enteramente al cultivo del maíz, papa, alfalfa y principalmente trigo , las cuales ella misma se encarga de comercializar para obtener las ganancias necesarias. Su gran anhelo es ver a sus 2 últimos hijos terminando sus carreras universitarias razón por la cual sigue trabajando con mucho esfuerzo.
Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA y está muy agradecida por obtener el préstamo que necesita para lograr sus objetivos , además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Pelaya; invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Pelaya is 62 years old and is happily married. She lives with three of her six children in the house she inherited 37 years ago. She is very happy for having worked so hard all her life in agriculture, because her years of experience working the land have brought her a lot of satisfaction. The reason is that for 32 years, she and her husband have known how to get ahead by cultivating the land. This important source of income has allowed them to economically support their six children, who are for the most part all good children.

At the moment Pelaya works full-time growing wheat, but also corn, potatoes and alfalfa. She herself takes charge of selling these crops to obtain the profits she needs. Her greatest desire is to see her two youngest children finish their university careers, which is the reason she continues to work with so much effort and determination.

This is Pelaya’s fourth loan with Kiva, and she is very grateful for the loan, as she needs it to achieve her objectives. She promises to be punctual with her loan payments. She will use the 3000 PEN to buy organic fertilizer for the next sowing of her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Dúo San Carlos Group

texts.es:
DÚO SAN CARLOS 
Doña Lucila es originaria de la aldea Chajalajya Tecpan, tiene 49 años de edad bajo su responsabilidad están sus 5 hijos menores de edad,  ella se dedica a elaborar tejidos típicos a mano y a la agricultura.
Desde hace algunos años ella se dedica a esta actividad ya que es el único medio que han tenido para salir adelante.
El esposo de ella se dedica a la agricultura, gracias al apoyo de el y de sus hijos ella sigue adelante con su negocio.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y poder mandar a sus hijos a la escuela, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de tejidos tipicos a mano, espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
DÚO SAN CARLOS 

Lucila is from the village of Chajalajya Tecpan, she is 49 years old and is responsible for her 5 young children. She makes a living weaving typical fabrics by hand, and also works in agriculture. 
She has made a living in this business for some years, as it's the only means she has had to succeed. Her husband works in agriculture, and thanks to his and her children's support she is moving forward with her business.
Lucila's dream is to expand her business further in order to make higher profits and send her children to school. She is requesting this loan to but raw material to make handwoven typical fabircs. She hopes you can help her with the loan she is requesting.

loans.use: to buy typical fabrics to sell.

loans.name: Cecilla

texts.en:
This is Cecilla. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the needed ingredients and products for her food stall. Her income helped with their household expenditures. She has been in this business for seven years now. She and her husband work hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Cecilla would like to apply for another 20,000 Philippine peso loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help meet her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Cecilla hopes to keep her customers and dreams of saving for their future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Akutay Fish Seller Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Akutay Fish Seller” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of 4,000,000 Leones (SLL). With this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more profit, and consequently, improve their standard of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Fatty. She is 30 years of age. Fatty was born in Kenema city, where she is residing together with her husband and two children. Her husband is a businessman, and one of her children is attending primary school. Fatty has been in business for many years. She has been selling fresh fish. With this loan, she will buy cartons of fresh fish to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy cartons of fresh fish to add to her business

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco is 56 years old and still single. He is working as a farmer and he earns an average of 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) during the harvest season. He wants to sustain his corn production, and this is the reason  he is asking for an additional loan of 35,000 PHP from KIVA lenders through ASKI to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers and corn seedlings. He hopes that his loan request will be granted for further improvement in the business.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers and corn seedlings

loans.name: Milena

texts.es: Milena, de 32 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de sus padres y 7 hermanos a los que apoya en la casa de sus padres, donde vive desde que nació.Es una mujer soltera, no se siente mal por ello, pues ayuda a sus hermanos y se supera día a día, “eso es lo más importante”, afirma. Estudió educación en una Universidad reconocida, ahí obtuvo toda la experiencia necesaria para poder desenvolverse en su carrera. Ahora trabaja en un proyecto de educación en donde ella es supervisora de la zona, ahí se encarga de velar el cumplimiento de la alfabetización de los ancianos y adultos que no lograron culminar sus estudios, le gusta mucho esta noble misión y está dichosa de ayudar a las personas a superarse. Pero también se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos, junto a sus hermanos realizan un promedio de 29 millares por semana, no puede dedicarse a tiempo completo, por ello produce muy poco. Pero ahora está pensando contratar trabajadores del lugar para que puedan fabricar más ladrillos.Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA, donde agradece al apoyo de todos ustedes, ya que obtendrá el préstamo que necesita para lograr sus objetivos , además se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas .Milena, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de arcilla y leña para la fabricación de ladrillos.
texts.en:
Milena is 32 years old and is a hardworking woman. She lives with her parents and seven siblings, who she supports in her parents home, where she has lived since she was young. She is single, but she doesn't mind, because she helps her siblings and she betters herself every day, “that's the most important thing”, she says. She studied education in a well-known University, which is where she obtained all the experience she needs to develop her career. 

She now works in an education project, for which she is the regional supervisor. She is responsible for ensuring the literacy of the elderly and adults who never finished their studies. She really enjoys this worthy mission and she is happy to help people to better themselves. She also works making bricks, with her siblings they make 29 thousand per week on average. She can't dedicate all of her time to this, which is why she doesn't produce many. But she is now thinking of hiring local workers to make more bricks. This is her fourth loan with Kiva, and she is grateful for the support of everyone, since she will secure the loan she needs to achieve her goals. She is committed to making her loan repayments on time

Milena will invest the 1500 soles in buying clay and wood to make bricks.

loans.use: to buy clay and wood to make bricks.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. Catalina has been in this business for six years now. Catalina requested a 20,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. In the future, Catalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
Hussain is from Iraq. He is 50 years old, married and has five children. Hussain and one of his children provide the family income, while the rest of his children are students.

Hussain owns a small shop where he sells glass plates which are used for the installation of display windows. He not only sells these glass blocks but also specializes in their installation. These glass blocks are highly demanded in the area. After working with his friend for almost seven years in this field, in 2009, Hussain established his own business. His business has grown rapidly because he is famous for this work and he has a lot of experience. 

Hussain is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to rent the shop next door in order to expand his business. Through this loan, Hussain aims to improve his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to pay the tuition fees of his four children.

loans.use: to rent the shop next door in order to expand his business

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en: Aiza is 21 years old, married, and has one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Aiza has a food vending business in the Philippines. Aiza requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like rice, sugar, salt, etc. for her food production business. Aiza has been in this business for two years. In the future, Aiza would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, sugar, salt, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Rampei

texts.en:
Rampei has paid off his previous loan and his farming business is flourishing. He has since acquired a bigger portion of land where he intends to expand his wheat farm. 

He has acquired another loan of 50,000 KES, which he will use to pay the cost of preparing the extra piece of land and to purchase farm inputs.

He will use the increased proceeds to buy more livestock for fattening and resale. His hope is to grow his farming into a commercial venture as well as to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
This is Mira. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the needed products for her variety store and it also helped in the education of her children. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. She also has a piggery and a jeepney for additional income.

She would like to apply for another loan of 25,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and pay for children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Mira hopes that all her businesses will expand and dreams that she and her family will have a good and prosperous life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is 28 years old man from Vihiga County, located in western Kenya.  He supports three people in his family and is married to Pauline, a business lady. He has two children, ages seven and three years old.

Felix has a butcher shop and has been operating this business for the last 14 years, making a monthly income of 20,000 KES. He is taking his third loan, with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase one cow for slaughter to add stock of meat at his butchery shop. This will increase the volume of sales which will result in more income.  

He will use the anticipated profits to uplift his business.  His dream is to become the leading person in the market who produces quality meats in the town.

loans.use: to purchase cows for slaughter.

loans.name: Fishery Women Group

texts.en:
Salamatu is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Makeni city, 43 years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple has four children, one in secondary and three in college. She has been in business for many years now. She has been selling fresh fish.

Together, the group members are asking for a loan of SLL 2,500,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Salamatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business. She will buy cartons of fresh fish to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: to buy cartons of fresh fish to add to her current inventory

loans.name: Cyril

texts.en:
This is Cyril. The loan that she acquired helped in her business a lot. It also helped in her family's everyday expenditures and the children's education. She has this business for twenty years. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would now like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan for her to purchase more fruits and vegetables needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Cyril dreams of having another stall for her business and hopes that her whole family will always have a good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week.  There, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fruit and vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ntetia

texts.en:
Ntetia and her husband are doing well in their farming venture. Ntetia has successfully paid off her previous loan and has applied for another loan of KES. 50,000 which has assisted her to acquire a bigger piece of land and also buy farm inputs. 


She had grown different types of crops and she hopes to diversify to rearing of animals.

Her children are all now in school and she hopes to educate them to higher levels thus raising the family's living standards. Her dream is to attain financial stability.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and also to hire a bigger piece of land.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Divino Niño Jesus está en su primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres,  son mujeres trabajadoras   donde todas  se ayudan por salir adelante. Tienen muchas ganas de crecer y ayudar a sus familias. Ellas son de la ciudad de Curuguaty, una ciudad todavía con difícil acceso a ciertas zonas, y es justamente en una de ellas que viven estas mujeres.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Clemencia, quien se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cabras, cerdos y demás que cría y luego faena o vende. Comenta que es un trabajo muy sacrificado ya que debe de estar pendiente siempre de sus animales todo el día. Su sueño es poder tener un día una granja grande donde poder seguir con la cría de muchos animales más.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales y de esa forma evitar que les falte algo.
texts.en:
Divino Niño Jesus (Holy Child Jesus) is a group working their first cycle of the women Committee’s program. These are hardworking women, helping each other out to get ahead in life. They have a great desire to progress and to help their families. They come form the town of Curuguaty, a place where some areas are still difficult to reach, and it is precisely in one of these areas that these women live.
Clemencia is a member of this group. She engages in breeding and selling farmyard animals such as hens, goats and pigs, first breeding them and then slaughtering or selling them. She says hers is a very demanding job, as she always has to care for her animals all day long. She dreams of succeeding in owing a big farm someday, where to keep on breeding many more animals.
She is requesting a loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of balanced feed for her animals, in order to make sure they do not lack what they need.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Juliet is 37 years old and has two children who are in school.

Juliet has an eatery business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like rice, spices, vegetables, meat, etc. for her food production business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her eatery business.

Juliet has been in this business for seven years. Juliet would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like rice, spices, vegetables, meat, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is an Iraqi client who is 45 years old, married, and has six children. Ali works hard to provide his family’s income all by himself.

Ali owns a small shop where he sells mobile phone and their accessories. He established his business in 2009 and has gained good experience in this field. Ali now has two employees hired and is becoming well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation since he not only sells mobile phones but also provides free maintenance services for his customers.

Ali is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to pay the annual rent of his shop. Ali aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to make his dream come true, and that is to educate his children and allow them to reach higher levels.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop

loans.name: Kheirallah

texts.en:
Kheirallah is a married Iraqi client, who is 43 years old and has six children. He and three of his children work to provide the family’s income, while the other three continue their studies.

Kheirallah owns a small shop and sells women's outfits. He has excellent experience in this field, since he worked at several similar shops. In 2010, Kheirallah established his own business and has earned an excellent reputation thanks to his very competitive prices.

Kheirallah is requesting a loan of $3,000 US. He will use this loan to renovate his shop, install signage, buy an air conditioner and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to provide his family better living conditions and be able to continue to cover his children’s school fees.

loans.use: to renovate his shop, install signage, buy an air conditioner and to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is 30 years old, married and blessed with two children.  Farming has been Rolando's primary source of income. He is thankful because his wife is very supportive in his chosen business.  

Rolando is a loving husband and responsible father to his two children. He plans to buy farm inputs such as seedlings, fertilizer and chemicals needed to improve his rice field, but he struggles for lack of capital. To pursue his plans, he is now asking for a loan of PHP 30,000. He hopes that his loan request will be granted so he may further maintain his business and have an increase in income.  Rolando believes that his success relies on his own determination, hard work and patience.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seedlings, fertilizer and chemicals needed to improve his rice field

loans.name: Santa Rita Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Rita está ubicado en Remansito, Chaco, está en su ciclo número cinco del programa de comité de mujeres, donde cada una de ellas lucha por salir adelante, dar a sus hijos una vida digna y un futuro mejor.
La Sra. Veronica se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene un pequeño kiosco bien surtido donde todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas. Ella lucha y se esfuerza por salir adelante, y el día de mañana convertir su pequeño Kiosco en una amplia despensa, con la cual podrá mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. Ella cuenta que gracias a que siempre es muy amable y tiene buenos precios en su negocio es que le está yendo muy bien.
Esta solicitando de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de fideos, arroz, aceite, azúcar, yerba, harina, pan y de esa forma poder seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan y piden.
texts.en:
Santa Rita Group is located in Remansito, Chaco. They are working their fifth cycle of the women Committee’s program, and every one of them strives to get ahead in life and to provide their children with a dignified life and a better future.
Veronica is a retailer, owing a small and well supplied stall where she works every day from very early in the morning. She strives and makes efforts to get ahead in life, and her plan for the future is to transform her small stall into a big store with which improve her family’s standard of living as well as her own. She says that her activity is going very well because she is always very kind and her prices are good.
She is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of noodles, rice, oil, sugar, maté, flour and bread, in order to keep on offering her customers everything they need and ask for.

loans.use: To buy noodles, rice, oil, sugar, maté, flour and bread.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con su hijo y su esposo en casa propia, es una mujer luchadora y responsable para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para la subsistencia. Actualmente trabaja vendiendo fruta cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona amable a la hora de atender al cliente, la clienta desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas, fruta como: mangos, sandias,etc. refrescos y agua y asi poder tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso que solicita un crédito para comprar lo dicho; y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia lo necesario sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
The client lives with her son and her husband in their own home.  She is a determined and responsible woman, so that her family does not lack what is necessary for survival.  

She currently works selling fruit near her place of residence.  She has had a lot of customers for several years because she is a very friendly person when she is waiting on her customers.

The client wishes to expand her stall, that is, to buy tables, chairs, fruit such as mangos, watermelon, etc., soft drinks and water, so that she can have a little more income, but she does not have sufficient revenue for this investment.  This is why she is applying for a loan to buy the aforementioned, and thus to earn more in order to give her family what is necessary without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, fruits, vegetables, soft drinks and water, etc.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 43 years old, married, and has four children. She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has been in pig fattening for five years, and she earns additional income by selling ready-to-wear clothes.

Mercy is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Eyad Baysour Group

texts.en:
Amal is the featured borrower of Eyad Baysour's group. She joined with the other group members to apply for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Amal is a 41-year-old widow who has been working in food production. She specializes in the mouneh business, which aims at a food preservation strategy, allowing foods from one season to be eaten another time during which they are not typically available. She started five years ago to provide her family with the necessary living needs since her husband passed away. She is taking the role of the loving mother and the hardworking father at the same time.

The loan for which she applied will help her to increase her production, through buying the present season's production to prepare the foods for the other seasons in which they are not available, and selling them at good prices. She is well known in her region with the good quality of products she sells, in addition to the special competitive prices she sets. She hopes to keep increasing her production and expanding her work to open a wide shop in the future.

Amal is pictured on the far right.

Samira is the second from the left. She is a 54-year-old married woman and mother of two. She has worked in handmade souvenirs for ten years. The loan requested will be invested in preparing for her daughter's expected baby needs.

Safaa is the second from the right. She is a 19-year-old single woman who works as a cashier in a restaurant to pay for her university needs. Today Safaa's requested loan will be used to pay her university fees.

Fairouz is a 37-year-old married woman who has worked in the handmade goods business for five years. The loan requested will be invested in her expected baby preparations.

loans.use: to buy the present season's production and prepare for the other seasons where the foods are not available

loans.name: Miguel Estuardo

texts.es:
MIGUEL  tiene 36 años de edad es soletro tiene un hijo, vive en casa con los padres en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

Miguel se dedica a realizar caramelos tradicionales cómo colaciones, canguil de dulce, habas fritas. Solicita el crédito para comprar maní, canguil, azúcar, colorantes, panela, canela, gelatina. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para trabajar. Las compras las realizará en Chimbo. 

El sueño a pesar de la edad es poder terminar de estudiar. Enfrenta desafío cómo la competencia y la mala salud. En el tiempo libre le gusta leer la biblia o libros interesantes.
texts.en:
Miguel is 36 years old and single. He has one child and lives at his parents' house in Chimbo, within the province of Bolívar. 

Miguel makes a living making traditional candies including "colaciones" (a sugar based candy), candied popcorn, fried fava beans. He is requesting this loan to buy peanuts, popcorn, sugar, colorings, brown sugar, cinnamon and gelatin. 

With the help of this loan he will be able to buy what he lacks in order to work. He will make his purchases within Chimbo. 

Despite his age, Miguel's dream is to finish his studies. He faces challenges of competition and poor health. In his free time he likes to read the Bible and other interesting books.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, popcorn, sugar, colorings, brown sugar, cinnamon and gelatin.

loans.name: Whilintons

texts.es:
Whilntons, de 36 años es un hombre soltero y responsable. Vive en compañía de sus padres en la casa que compraron juntos hace 2 años. Desde hace 4 años adquirió un ómnibus, “Compré el carro con mucho esfuerzo ya que quise tener mi propio negocio”, afirma. Es así que incursionó en el trasporte público cubriendo algunas rutas de la zona. Durante este tiempo obtuvo buenos ingresos, gracias al aumento de población. Ahora desea mantener a su auto en buenas condiciones para no tener problemas durante el viaje, aunque es en zona urbana, desea tener a sus clientes seguros para que puedan confiar en él. Su deseo a largo plazo es tener su propia empresa de trasportes, comprar más carros y ser uno de los mejores.  
Éste es su primer crédito con KIVA y agradece al apoyo de todos ustedes, ya que obtendrá el préstamo que necesita para lograr sus objetivos , además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Whilintons, invertirá los S/.500 soles en el mantenimiento de su vehículo.
texts.en:
Whilintons is 36 years of age and single. He is a responsible man, and lives with his parents in the house they bought together two years ago. Four years ago he bought a minibus, and says “I bought the bus after a lot of effort, as I wanted to have my own business”. This is how he started working in public transportation, covering a number of routes in the area. During this time he has obtained a good income, thanks to the rise in the local population. 

Whilintons now wants to keep his vehicle in good condition so that he has no problems during his journeys, even though they take him through urban areas. He wants to keep his customers safe, so that they can trust him. In the long term he wants to have his own transportation company, buy more vehicles, and be one of the best in his field. 

This is Whilintons’ first loan from Kiva. He thanks you all for your help, as he will obtain the loan he needs to meet his goals. He also promises to repay his loan installments on time. He plans to invest the 500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles he receives in carrying out maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance on his vehicle

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
This is Mary Ann, 47, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rodrigo, and a mother to her children. By the grace of God, she has managed to support her children's schooling. She is working hard continually, to provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Mary Ann oversees the operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has one jeepney unit (14-16 person capacity), for which she charges boundary (a fixed amount of money) each day. Her regular passengers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan. She will use the loan to pay for the maintenance of her jeepney unit and to buy spare parts. She expects a boost in her business income, as she expands her business.  

Mary Ann hopes to have more jeepneys, and dreams of living happily. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

-Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of the jeepney unit.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman; she has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a computer bureau business. She faces stiff competition in her business. With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase a photocopying machine. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a photocopying machine.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 50 years old and lives in Khashuri district with his retired mother. David requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 
David is an artisan who makes steel doors for private orders in his own workshop. Additional income comes from David’s mother’s monthly pension.
David requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. David has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, David will start trading with cement. He will buy cement bags at wholesale prices from the cement factory in Kaspi district and sell the bags with the prices marked up at the local market in Khashuri. This new business will give David an opportunity to earn additional income for the family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To start a retail business selling cement.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
Clement is 32 years old, married to Maureen, and the father of four children aged 10, 8, 6 and 4 years. He has been in the motorcycle transport business in Bomet town and its outskirts for the last four years, earning a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

Clement learnt about Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), a partner of World Vision International, from his colleagues in the industry, who have already been funded by KADET Ltd. He is servicing his third loan of 50,000 KES which he has added to his savings to purchase his own motorcycle.

He will use the proceeds to meet the family's basic needs. His dream is to see his children attain high levels of learning.

loans.use: to add to his savings in order to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is a teacher with many years of experience teaching in the local school. She lives with her husband, daughter, son and mother-in-law. Narine's son Gurgen (in the photo) is 23 years old and studies at Public Administration Academy of the Republic of Armenia, where he is in the second course. 
Narine's salary allows her to cover her household costs, but is not enough to save for Gurgen's education.
She has applied for this loan to pay for her son's university tuition. The loan is very important for Narine and her son. Gurgen dreams of becoming a lawyer after graduation and having a job with enough salary to be financially independent. This loan is important for him to continue his education and make his dream come true.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 30 years old and lives in Kakamega county, which is found in the western part of Kenya, She is married to Luvasi who is a businessman in the same location. She helps support her husband and two children, ages 6 and 2.

She sells cereals, a business she started three years ago, and makes a monthly income of KES 30,000. She has applied for her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to add to her stock of maize, beans, green grams (mung beans) and millet for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

Her dreams is to become a supplier and to give her children the best education in their lives.

loans.use: To purchase maize, green grams (mung beans) and millet.

loans.name: Dúo Chajalajya Group

texts.es:
DÚO CHAJALAJYA
Doña Leticia es originaria de la aldea chajalajya Tecpan, tiene 37 años de edad  bajo su responsabilidad están sus 3 hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías (elaboracion y venta de comales)y a la crianza de pollos.
Desde hace algunos años ella se a dedicado a esta actividad ya que es el medio que tiene para salir adelante.
El esposo de ella trabaja como jornalero  y gracias al apoyo de el doña Leticia sigue adelante con su negocio.
Ella sueña tener un negocio más amplio ya que así obtendrá mejores ganancias y mandar a sus hijos a la escuela,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materiales para la elaboracion de comales.
texts.en:
DÚO CHAJALAJYA [Group]

Leticia is from the village of Chajalajya Tecpan. She is 37 years old and is responsible for her 3 children under the age of 18. She works in manufacturing (making and selling griddles) and raising chickens.

In recent years she has worked doing this activity because it is the means by which she can get ahead. Her husband works as a day laborer and thanks to the support of Leticia continues his business.

She dreams of having a larger business so she will get better profits and send her children to school. She is applying for this loan to buy materials to make griddles.

loans.use: to buy materials to make and sell griddles

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es: José de 36 años de edad vive junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 8 y 6 años en casa propia, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz,  pipianes y fruta como melón y sandia , tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, cuando sus cosechas ya estan listas las almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografia para luego salir a comercializarlas en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; el necesita invertir por eso le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida, etc. Jose  tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica
texts.en:
Jose is 36 years old and lives with his wife and their two children, aged 8 and 6 years, in their own home. 

He works growing corn, pumpkins and fruit such as melon and watermelon. He has worked in agriculture for several years and he has gained a lot of experience, which means he gets the best crops. When his crops are ready, he stores them in barns as you can see in the photograph, and later goes and sells them in the surrounding areas of the community. He already has lots of customers who prefer his crops because of the quality, good prices and above all for the good service. 

He needs to invest so has applied for a loan to buy seeds for corn, beans, insecticide, herbicide, e.t.c. Jose has good payment references from his acquaintances, and is very responsible. He guarantees that he will be able to pay the debt back within the prescribed period and also hopes to bring financial security to his household.

loans.use: to buy seeds for corn, beans, insecticide, herbicide, e.t.c.

loans.name: Yadhira Lucero

texts.en:
Yadhira is a Kubo Financiero client. This is her story:
