After graduating from Junior high school, Ruth decided to set up her own beauty salon business in Asekie (near Takoradi). With over 8 years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. 

As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more hair cream, hair extensions and a hair dryer to make her work easier. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support the upkeep of her house, whilst also ensuring that her children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more hair cream, hair extensions and a hair dryer to make her work easier.

loans.name: Yudaya

texts.en:
Yudaya is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother). She has a business of selling green bananas and has been in this business for 6 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She generates additional income through making ledger books and beads. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only.  

Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. Yudaya is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also to buy a delivery van for ease in transportation. She resides in a rented house where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and the rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married with 5 children. She received some schooling through the end of Middle School. Currently, Agnes sells palm oil in Yabiw (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this industry for about 25 years now. Her husband is a security guard. Agnes’ income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. 

She will use the loan to increase her existing palm oil inventory. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Agnes plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing palm oil inventory.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 42 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su joven hija, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, lamentablemente por diversas circunstancias de la vida, se separó de su esposa, pero él dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su hija, Miguel no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Contabilidad que deseaba, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver pelicular y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Cau Cau para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Miguel trabaja como ayudante en una panadería, el se encarga de mezclar la masa y de hornear los panes, Miguel trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Miguel se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de los servicios higiénicos de su vivienda, ya que desea mejorar el lavadero y comprar materiales para acondicionar la ducha, de esta manera Miguel podrá brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propia panadería.
texts.en:
42-year-old Miguel lives in the city of Pisco with his young daughter who he loves dearly.  Miguel is a very friendly, hardworking, enthusiastic man.  Sadly, for a number of reasons, he separated from his wife but he now puts all of his effort into providing for his daughter.  Miguel was not able to study for a degree in accountancy as he wanted to because he had to work to help his parents from a very young age.  In his free time, he enjoys watching movies and he sometimes cooks a delicious 'arroz con cau cau' to share with his family.

With a lot of determination and dedication, Miguel works as an assistant in a bakery.  He is in charge of mixing the dough and baking the bread.  He works approximately 10 hours every day and believes that he is doing well because he puts a lot of effort into his work and treats others in a friendly manner.

Miguel is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he will be able to improve the sanitation in his home.  He would like to replace the sink and buy materials for a shower.  In this way, Miguel will be able to improve his family's well-being.  He will also continue working hard to achieve his big dream of opening own bakery.

loans.use: to improve sanitation in his home

loans.name: Romalda

texts.en:
Romalda has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

A $1,200 loan has been offered to Romalda to improve her business. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee and a refrigerator to keep drinks.

loans.use: to buy, biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee and refrigerator to keep drinks.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She opened her kiosk a 1995 with her own working capital of $2,000.

She is taking a loan of $1,200 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits.   

She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks and biscuits.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is married, 46 years-old and lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.  She has six children. Fe buys and sells fish to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years and earns 8,000 a month which only supports their basic needs. 

She joined Kiva partner GDMPC in 2008 in order to gain access to financial services. She is requesting a loan of 13,000.00 PHP in order to repair the existing boat and to purchase a new fishing net. In the future, Fe wants to buy another fishing boat.

loans.use: to  repair the existing boat and purchase a new fishing net.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela is applying for a loan of $1200 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 23 years old. She runs a kiosk in front of a market, and she will use the loan to buy stocks to sell in her store, such as laundry detergent, bathing soaps, hand and body lotion, and other items.. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: to buy laundry detergent, bathing soaps, hand and body lotion, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en: Delfina is taking a loan of $1000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She has a shop that generates income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She feels better after she applied for her first loan. She will use it to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, such as shirts, t-shirts, and pants for children and adults. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) because it offers loan to poor people.

loans.use: to buy shirts, t-shirts, and pants for children and adults.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is a 62-year-old man living in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He owns and manages his sari sari (convenience) store business, selling goods in the local community. For 14 years, he's been earning 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month for a living. 

In 2008, he joined GDMPC and recently requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. Antonio plans to use his revenue and part of this loan to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a married mother of four children who attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition from other clothes sellers. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to buy more clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Keneth

texts.en:
Keneth is single man of twenty six years, he supports his mother and young sister. He is a dairy farmer and also sells second hand clothes. Keneth has been in this business for six years now and gets monthly income of fourteen thousand shillings.

This will be Keneth's seventh loan with KADET LTD, and plans to use the entire loan to buy a bail of jackets for sale. In the future, Keneth plans to buy more cows for his dairy farming business.

loans.use: To buy a bail of jackets.

loans.name: Alfred S.'s Group

texts.en: In the photo are staff of a leading relief NGO in Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan of 6,000,000 in order to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial challenges. Staff at various government and non-governmental organizations do normally come to SMT to apply for loans. These loans are very useful in helping them meet certain financial constrains that their salaries cannot meet. Then at the end of each month, their finance officer will deduct the amount they owe SMT/Kiva lenders and repays on their behalf. Alfred is the featured leader of this group of two. He is 40 years of age. Alfred is a native of Makeni city. He is married to a school teacher and together, they have one child who is attending primary school. Alfred has been working for this NGO for four years now. He has requested for this loan in order to buy house building materials such as iron corrugated sheets, sand, cement, nails, etc. for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials such as iron corrugated sheets, sand, cement, nails, etc. for the construction of a house.

loans.name: Kenga

texts.en:
Kenga is 47 years old, married, and a father of three children. For the past three years, he has earned a living by operating point-to-point transport services with his three motorbikes in Malindi town, from which he earns a monthly profit of KES 15,100. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for his third loan of KES. 30,000. He is going to use the loan to service and repair his motorbikes. He will use the profits to pay school fees for his children as well as continue investing back into his business. 

His goal for the future is to expand his business so as to have more motorcycles  enabling his family be financially stable.

loans.use: To service and repair his motorcycles for his business.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Because of difficult circumstances, Faustina did not have access to formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Faustina sells frozen chicken in Asebu Ekrokul (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about two years. She is married to a mechanic, and they have three children together. Faustina uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Faustina will use the loan to buy more chicken, which will help her to  improve her overall sales. Faustina wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to buy more chicken to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Because of difficult circumstances, Mary did not have access to formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Mary sells saucepans in Asebu Ekrokul (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about three years. She is married to a farmer, and they have seven children together. Mary uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Mary will use the loan to buy more saucepans, which will help her to improve her overall sales. Mary wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase more saucepans to sell.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Charlotte is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling charcoal in Asebu Ekrokul (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for four years. Charlotte is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband to cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees. Charlotte wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, which will allow her to sell greater quantities of charcoal. In the long term, Charlotte plans to reinvest future profits in her business, thus helping her expand and meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, which will allow her to sell greater quantities of charcoal.

loans.name: Chattar

texts.en:
Originally from India, Chattar found his calling as an educator and entrepreneur after moving to El Paso to obtain his master of business administration degree from the University of Texas - El Paso. He started teaching math at a local middle school and discovered his calling. Eventually he opened a tutoring business that rapidly grew by word of mouth.

“I enjoy teaching,” Chattar said. “And the students I had learned a lot with my background and my patience and my teaching style.”

Chattar started teaching at a high school and saw that there was a strong need for one-on-one tutoring in math. So he started tutoring his high school students. Eventually, he used his business training background to start a tutoring business. Originally he called the business MathMobile, because math was his specialty. 

“But thereafter it just grew,” Chattar said. “The parents we had started referring us to other clientele and we just grew. And now we have 25 tutors and we just run the business and make sure we hire the right type of people to work as tutors.”

Chattar changed the name of the business to Texas Mobile Tutorials to better reflect the broad range of subjects the company tutors: math, English/reading, social studies, biology, chemistry, physics, history, test preparation, computer programs, and other topics.

Recently, Texas Mobile Tutorials became an approved provider under the Texas Education Agency’s Supplemental Educational Services program, enabling Chattar’s company to serve low-income students in schools at risk of failing to meet state education standards. 

The contract might seem like a boon for Chattar’s tutorial business. But Chattar said he has to pay his tutors and buy the books and other material up front. He is guaranteed payment by the state, but weeks after services have already been delivered. 

So Chattar applied for a working capital loan with Accion Texas Inc. after learning about the nonprofit organization through the Small Business Administration in El Paso. Using his $5,450 loan to buy materials and to pay tutors immediately after rendering services, Chattar said he was able to pick up 10 students from the state program. 

Chattar said he hopes to serve more students through the program as he builds his capital, pays off his loan, and eventually obtains revolving credit for his business.
 
“We would have had to let go of those students if we didn’t get the Accion Texas loan,” Chattar said.

loans.use: to buy materials and pay tutors.

loans.name: Virna

texts.es: Virna tiene 31 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, responsable, vive en una casa alquilada a lado de su esposo y su hijo.Virna tiene una pequeña empresa dedicada al alquiler de maquinarias y venta de materiales de construcción. Se inició en esta actividad junto a su esposo pero ella se queda a cargo de la empresa y su esposo maneja el trabajo de campo, supervisando el uso de las máquinas y los productos necesarios para la construcción. Eventualmente Virna vende mercadería buscando obtener ingresos extras para mejorar su calidad de vida. Al principio no contaban con el capital ni con las herramientas necesarias para abrir su empresa pero despues de mucho esfuerzo logro obtener el capital necesario para ponerlo a flote y ahora con las ganancias que obtiene espera seguir creciendo para ampliar y mejorar la infraestructura de su local.Para Virna este es el primer crédito con Kiva, y agradece el apoyo económico recibido por lo que se  compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Con el monto solicitado de S/.3000 soles comprará arena , fierro , ladrillos, entre otros materiales para una construcción que realizará en la carretera.
texts.en:
31-year old Virna is a hardworking, responsible woman who lives in a rented house with her husband and son. She has a small business renting out equipment and selling construction materials. She began the business with her husband but now she is in charge while he works on site, supervising the use of the machinery and the products needed for construction. 

Currently Virna sells merchandise as she is seeking to earn extra income to improve their quality of life. At the beginning they didn’t have enough capital nor the tools necessary to open their business but after a lot of hard work, she managed to obtain the money she needed to get it going, and now with the income she hopes to continue growing the business by expanding and improving the premises.

This is Virma’s first loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial assistance. She promises to make the repayments punctually. With the S/. 3,000 soles she is seeking, she will buy construction supplies such as sand, metal, and bricks for a building she will erect on the highway.

loans.use: buy construction supplies such as sand, metal, and bricks

loans.name: Salua

texts.en: Salua is a 24-year-old married woman from Lod. She is a trained bookkeeper but, given her love of children and dedication to early childhood education, she decided to open a daycare center. There is much demand for daycare in her city and, working with her mother, she has opened a popular and respected childcare center. Due to the high demand, Salua is expanding her center to take on more children. She needed this loan to pay for renovations and buy additional mattresses for nap time, bedding, and age-appropriate educational and play toys. Salua wants to help to meet the demand for good child care for working mothers in her city. She is working to ensure that the renovations are completed before the sign-up for the fall begins. This will allow additional children to be cared for in her center.

loans.use: to pay for renovations and buy additional mattresses for nap time, bedding and age-appropriate educational and play toys to expand her daycare center.

loans.name: Nyame

texts.en: Nyame is a small-scale farmer and seller of coconuts in Domenase (near Cape Coast). He has had some formal education and is a junior high school graduate. He is married and has five children. His wife is a trader. Nyame has been working as a farmer for close to 15 years. His income is used to help his wife pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. He plans on using his loan to expand his business, thus allowing him to meet rising customer demand, and he plans to use the profits to ensure that all his children receive an education.

loans.use: to expand his coconut business, thus allowing him to meet rising customer demand.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
This is Janeth, 46, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Noe and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Janeth operates a buy and sell business. She sells various snacks and other foods. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy snacks and other products.

Janeth dreams to expand her business and hopes that her children will finish their schooling.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for snacks and other products.

loans.name: Zaratou

texts.fr: Jeune femme célibataire et sans enfant, Zaratou afin de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens, a entamé l'année dernière le commerce de produits de détails. elle dresse son étalage au marché. Elle veut agrandir son étalage de marchandises, pour cette raison, elle sollicite de WAGES un second crédit pour agrandir son commerce. Elle espère se marier plus tard tout en assurant les besoins primaires de la famille.
texts.en: A young unmarried woman without children, Zaratou started a retail business last year in order to support herself from day to day. She sets up her display at the market. She wants to expand her display of merchandise. This is why she is requesting from WAGES a second loan to expand her business. She hopes to get married later while  making sure that her primary family's needs are met.

loans.use: to purchase retail products

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is taking a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is married and has four children. She has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as second-hand clothes, second-hand shoes and second-hand bags. She is happy that TRM offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes, second-hand shoes and second-hand bags.

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Mr. Davaasuren, 23 years old, lives with his wife in their own house on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his wife have been running a mobile-phone sales business for four consecutive years, and usually get their goods from Koreans or wholesalers. The income from the mobile-phone sales is not sustaining the family's expenses, and recently, he decided to begin rendering taxi service to the local people. 

He is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase an electric car. Electric cars contribute to cleaner air in cities because they produce no harmful pollution from the tailpipe from the on-board source of power, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead and various oxides of nitrogen. Purchasing this electric car will help him to generate more income from the taxi service as well as contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase an electric car.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. 

She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $500. She is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: El Sr. Sergio tiene 29 años y un hijo que tiene la edad de 3 años,  El Sr. Sergio se dedica  a la  reparación de autos, el es mecánico hace ya varios años, tiene su taller  ubicado en la Zona Virgen de Lujan   donde ofrece sus servicios,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  El Sr. Sergio va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de maquinaria para su taller como compresora,  y así de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  actividad, El Sr. Sergio va utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando  herramientas para seguir equipando su taller, El Sr. Sergio es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es su única actividad.
texts.en: Sergio is 29 years old and has a 3-year-old son.  His business is repairing cars.  He has been working as a mechanic for a number of years and has an auto repair shop in Virgen de Lujan district where he offers his services.  This loan is Sergio's first from the institution.  He will use it to buy machinery for his workshop such as a compressor.  This will allow him to provide his customers with a better service and increase his profits.  His reason for requesting this loan is so that he can continue improving in his business.  Sergio will use the profits he makes to continue buying tools so that he can continue equipping his auto repair shop.  Sergio is a very hard-working person who feels happy to be receiving this opportunity as this is his only business.

loans.use: to buy machinery for his workshop (a compressor)

loans.name: Jenus

texts.en:
Jenus is a 57-year-old married man who has only one child. He lives in Canubay, Oroquieta City, where he buys and sells home products to earn a living. He has been doing this for two years, having an income of 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month. 

Recently, he joined GDMPC and requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory products. In the future, Jenus dreams to double his income just to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a responsible housewife who runs a variety store in her village. She decided to engage in this livelihood to assist her husband in generating income. 

She is 39 years old, gifted with two children. She and her husband aim to improve their living standard to educate their children and to give them a better life. For this reason, she plans to make more improvements in the business by increasing her product offerings. 

To fulfill that dream, she is asking for the loan amount of P12,000.00 to buy additional stocks of rice, frozen foods, soft drinks, laundry soaps, canned goods, beverages and seasonings for her to offer to her valued customers. Through this she believes that her variety store will become more profitable. She hopes that her requested loan will be granted.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice, frozen foods, soft drinks, laundry soaps, canned goods, beverages and seasonings to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a man of forty five years, married to Lucy and a father of three children. He keeps pigs and also runs a retail shop in Kangemi. Samuel has been in this business for sixteen years now and gets monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings.

This will be Samuel's fourth loan with KADET LTD, he plans to use the entire loan to buy 20 piglets to rear and sell later at a profit. In the future, he wants to own more pigs and also educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase twenty piglets.

loans.name: Bawa

texts.en: Bawa is married and has seven children. He has received schooling through the basic level to the middle school level. Bawa is a petty trader who deals in bags of ginger, cola, and yam tubers in Hohoe, as he has done for three years. He travels to the northern part of Ghana to buy his items at cheaper prices and then resells them in the southern part. His wife is a food vendor. Bawa uses his income for all the financial needs of his household and other members of the extended family . Bawa will use the loan to buy bags of ginger, cola, and yam tubers. Bawa intends to reinvest the new profits from his expanded business to enhance his capital.

loans.use: to buy bags of ginger, cola, and yam tubers for his business as a trader.

loans.name: Fenny

texts.en:
Fenny is a woman of sixty two years. She is married to Charles and a mother of three children. She sells materials for making clothes and also African lesos, she has been in this business for seven years and gets monthly income of twenty-five thousand shillings.

This will be Fenny's second loan from KADET LTD, she plans to use the entire loan to buy new fabric materials for making clothes. In future she wants to be a wholesaler.

loans.use: To purchase fabric materials for dress making.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity owns a provisions shop in Wegbe, Hohoe. Charity received education to the middle school level. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. Charity has been selling provisions for four years. She helps her husband with some basic financial needs. Her loan will be used to buy bags of sugar, rice, margarine, sachets of milo and milk powder. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, rice, margarine, sachets of milo and milk powder to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy, slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks and biscuits.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is married and has seven children. She has never been to school. Stella is food vendor who cooks and sells a variety of dishes at Wegbe, Hohoe, as she has done for the past 11 years. Her main dishes are fufu and banku. Banku/akple is fermented corn/cassava dough mixed in proportion and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste. It is served with soup, stew, or a pepper sauce with fish. Fufu (also known as foofoo or foufou) is a paste made from starchy root vegetables put into a mortar and beaten smooth with a pestle. The malleable dough is served and eaten with a light tomato soup, groundnut soup, palm oil fruit soup, or another soup. Her husband is a farmer. Stella uses her income to give support to her husband in providing for the family. Stella will use the loan to buy bags of corn dough, bags of cassava, plantains, palm fruit, tomatoes, cartons of chicken and meat, and also to get extra hands to help with the cooking. With the new profits from her expanded business, Stella intended to save and reinvest so she can improve her profit margins.

loans.use: to buy bags of cassava and corn dough, bags of cassava, plantains, palm fruit, tomatoes, cartons of chicken and meat, and also to get extra hands to help with the cooking.

loans.name: Creselene

texts.en:
Creselene is married and has four children. She is 41 years old and resides at Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. 

Creselene owns and manages a piggery, raising piglets for sale to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years, earning 5,000 PHP monthly.

In 2009, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Recently, Creselene requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase piglets to raise.

She wants to make an improvement of her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family in the future.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise.

loans.name: Anapaula

texts.en:
Anapaula is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. 

She opened her kiosk in 2008 with her own working capital of $100. Anapaula is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther, de 20 años es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres junto a toda su familia.A pesar de su corta edad, ella se dedica a la siembra de diversos productos, cuenta que desde niña, le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra y vivir de ella, “me gusta mucho poder ayudar a mis padres, disfruto del campo, es tranquilo”, afirma. Es por ello que en los terrenos que tienen sus padres comenzó a sembrar papa, alverja, habas y demás hortalizas, los que abona con ayuda de sus hermanos, quienes constantemente se encuentran fertilizando y sembrando sus terrenos. Ahora, se encuentra en la siembra grande de el valle, por ello quiere invertir la mayor cantidad de capital que tiene, pues sabe que en la cosecha de enero, podrá obtener buenos resultados, ya que sus alimentos tienen compradore fijos.Este es el segundo crédito con Kiva y está muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero brindado.Esther, invertirá S/. 1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para distribuirlos entre sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Esther is 20 years old, single, and lives in her parents’ house with all her family. Despite being young, she earns her living growing a range of produce. Ever since she was a young girl she was taught how to work the land and live off it: “I love being able to help my parents,” she says, “and I enjoy the countryside as it is quiet.” For this reason  she began to grow potatoes, peas, beans and other vegetables on her parents’ land. With help from her siblings, she puts manure on the fields, and they all are constantly spreading fertilizer and planting crops. 

Now it is the important planting season in the valley, so Esther wants to invest as much money as she can because she knows that in the January harvest, she will earn good money as she already has buyers for the produce. 

This is Esther’s second loan with Kiva, and she is very grateful for the financial assistance. She plans to use the S/. 1000 soles to buy organic manure to spread on the potato crop.

loans.use: buy organic manure

loans.name: Badamtsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Badamtsetseg is 45 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a house in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. She has graduated as an agrarian and had been working at a private company for years until 2007. She started her own business of organic vegetable growing and selling with her husband in 2007. Her children also help their family business. She is a hardworking, optimistic and well-experienced woman. 

She grows her vegetables from March to October in her greenhouses, and she already built close relationships with her clients, who are retailers in the local market. She is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to build a smaller greenhouse to plant seedlings for her organic vegetables.

loans.use: to build a smaller greenhouse to plant seedlings for her organic vegetables.

loans.name: Joemarie

texts.en:
Joemarie is a father of five children and lives in the village of San Jose in the province of Isabela. He is a very simple farmer, and with the help of his wife, Marirose, attains the needs of his family. Regarding that, Joemarie is asking for a loan of 22,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow to sustain the needs of his farm. 

In the future, Joemarie hopes that his business expands so that he can meet the needs of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow to sustain the needs of his farm.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is a 55-year-old woman. She is married and has two children. She has her own business.

Olga has sold women’s clothes at the central market for 17 years. She always tries to choose good quality products. She is patient and hardworking.

Olga is asking for a loan in the amount of 7000 UAH. She wants to buy clothes for the summer season. The loan will help her to increase the income of the family.

loans.use: to buy clothes for the summer season

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
Marcelo, 51, is very friendly and hardworking. He lives with his wife and their children. He works very hard on his own plot of land, where he grows corn. His products are of great quality, and his harvest will sell at the various markets near to his home. 

Marcelo is asking for a loan amounting to 22,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to count on the money he needs to invest in agricultural supplies like pesticides and fertilizers, manure, seeds and other things that he needs for planting crops. 

He is anxious to increase his sales to be able to receive improved earnings and provide his family with financial stability.

loans.use: to buy supplies like pesticides and fertilizers, manure, seeds and other things that he needs for planting crops.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con sus padres y su hijo en casa del papa, ella se dedica a la se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y sorgo, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, ella comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles, la clienta es una mujer dedicada a su labor, luchadora siempre dispuesta a trabajar duro para alcanzar el éxito, quiere aprovechar el auge de su negocio para aumentar la producción y así poder tener mejores ganancias, necesita invertir en insumos pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, sorgo, abono, insecticida, herramienta, etc. confía que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en: The client lives with her parents and her son in the father's home. She is in agriculture for a living, specifically cultivating corn and sorghum. She has been working in this field for many years and it has been valuable experience that has allowed her the best crops. The cultivation land is located in an agricultural zone. She sells in all surrounding zones and already has many regular customers. These people always prefer her product as it is high quality and at affordable prices. The client is a woman dedicated to her work, a fighter always willing to work hard to succeed. She wants to take advantage of boom of her business to expand production and be able to have better earnings. She needs to invest in supplies but needs capital, for which she is requesting from INTEGRAL a loan that would allow her to buy corn seed, sorghum, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc. She is confident that she will be able to give her family the life that they deserve.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, sorghum, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc.

loans.name: Jose Adalberto

texts.es: Don José de 48 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 8 y 4 años de edad, es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo,  se dedica a ser agricultor siembra maíz y sorgo. Don José desea incrementar sus ventas por eso solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: 48-year-old José is a very responsible man when it comes to his family obligations and he always provides his family with the best.  José currently lives with his wife and their two children who are 8 and 4 years old.  He is a very hard-working man who has always worked cheerfully and enthusiastically.  His business is farming and he grows corn and sorghum.  José would like to increase his sales and so is requesting a loan with which to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, pesticides, etc.  He would like to be receive the help he has requested as this is his only source of income.  It will enable him to continue providing for his family without limitations.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Taliki-Hata Group

texts.en: Madalena is one of the members of the Taliki-Hata Group. She is taking out this loan to add to her her own working capital in order to buy some additional supplies including vegetables, such as potatoes, to sell. She is a hard working woman. She started her business in 2008 with her own working capital of $50.00.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies including vegetables, such as potatoes, to sell

loans.name: Rogie

texts.en: Rogie is 32 years old, married to Michelle, and blessed with three children. He has been in this business for the last five years, generating a monthly income of Php 5,000. He is taking out this loan of Php22,000 which he will use to purchase corn seedlings for planting. The anticipated profit will be used to do large-scale farming. His hopes and dreams are to succeed in farming.

loans.use: to purchase corn seedlings for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate and move her kitchen while making necessary upgrades to accommodate a restaurant, to serve Ethiopian food in Haifa.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
This is Analiza, 44, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Arnel, a driver, and they have children. She and her husband work hard to provide for their everyday expenses.

Analiza operates a beauty parlor business. She mainly offers hair cutting, coloring, straightening/relaxing, etc. She also offers manicures for finger nails. Some parlors also include massage. She also offers face make up. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community, usually women. She earns a minimum of Php400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more equipment for the parlor. 

Analiza hopes to have her own stall for her parlor and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for beauty products and hair products needed in her salon.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel lives with his wife and five children. He works farming rice, a business he has had for more than 10 years. With the income he earns from his sales, he is able to meet his household expenses. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase more seeds, manure and fertilizer and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph so that he can produce a larger quantity of basic grains. This will satisfy his customers so that he can increase his sales and give his family a more stable financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds, manure and fertilizer and to improve the land.

location.town: San Pedro San Pablo, Aurora, Isabela

loans.name: Zoryana

texts.en:
Zoryna is married. She has a 12-year-old son. Zoryna has her own business.

Zoryna has sold women’s clothes at the center market for four years. Her kiosk is located in a good place with a lot of people around. Most popular in her business is lingerie. Zoryna is a friendly and polite person. She is planning to buy her own kiosk in the future.

Zoryna is asking for a loan of 10,000 UAH (Ukrainian hryvnia) to buy lingerie, tunics and belts.

loans.use: to buy lingerie, tunics and belts.

loans.name: Dalton

texts.en:
Fifty-eight-year-old Dalton is married and has two children. He’s been involved in agriculture since he was 10 years old, as he had to help his parents work their land. To get to the fields where he grows his crops, he has to walk 2 kilometers and carry supplies on horseback. When he plants the corn, he transports it on wooden stakes, as the steep slopes make it impossible to use either a tractor or oxen. His harvest is just as good as that from flat fields.

When Dalton needs to buy supplies for his farm, he travels 30 minutes by bus from his hillside community.

He is requesting a loan to buy six bags of fertilizer, a gallon of herbicide, 50 pounds of corn seed and other supplies for his land. The money will help him obtain the necessary supplies in time and in sufficient quantities to ensure a good harvest. He will also be able to build a brick house so that his children can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy six bags of fertilizer, a gallon of herbicide, 50 pounds of corn seed and other supplies

loans.name: Ma. Melissa

texts.en:
Ma. Melissa is a business minded person from GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is 35 and she is happily married to Marlon. They have two children who are not yet in school. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business.

Ma. Melissa has a water vending machine. For only Php1.00, customers can have a glass of cold water. She also has a variety store, a coconut shake stall, a general merchandise and sells beauty products. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php42,000 in sales every week.

She is requesting a Php50,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy products and supplies needed in her water vending machine, variety store, coconut shake stall, general merchandise and beauty products businesses.

Ma. Melissa hopes that she will have more branches of her businesses and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay all the products needed in her water vending machine, variety store, coconut shake and beauty products.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
This is Cristina, 38, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is Jose, a pastor, and she is a mother to her two children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
  
Cristina operates an accessories retail business. What she basically does is buy accessory items from wholesalers and resells them per piece/pack with a profit. Products can range from beaded jewelries like necklaces to other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are students and mall patrons.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of accessory products to expand her product inventory.   

Cristina hopes that her business will expand and dreams that her children will finish their studies with the guidance of God. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more quantities and varieties of accessory products to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Kazim

texts.en:
Kazim is 51 years old, married, and the father of two children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) who lives with his wife and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Kazim is a Jabrayili refugee. For more than 15 years, he has been growing vegetables and fruit. Kazim is very hardworking and passionate in his work. He considers it fun to grow potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, and cultivate fruit trees with his wife. Kazim sells his crops in the central bazaar to earn a profit to support his family. He earns 100 AZN. 

Kazim is requesting a 2,000 AZN loan through Agroinvest to buy fertilizer and seed to expand his business. He will use his loan to grow more vegetables and fruit to increase his revenue this summer to provide for his family. Kazim believes  his dedication and effort will help him to expand and he looks forward to when his son will help with his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Yowasi

texts.en: Yowasi is a 60-year-old married man with 4 children living in Fort Portal ,Uganda. His main business is farming, and he does some carpentry to boost his income. He faces the hardship of unpredictable weather changes; however, he dreams of building a permanent home, educating his children to higher levels of learning and owning a modern workshop. Yowasi is requesting a loan to buy timber to make furniture.

loans.use: to buy timber for furniture making.

loans.name: Dashhuu

texts.en:
Dashhuu is a 54-year-old widow who lives alone in an apartment in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. She has a daughter and a son who are both married and living separately. Dashhuu used to run clothing business with her husband, but after he passed away she closed the business. She is now planning to re-open her clothing business and rent a counter in a local market. Dashhuu has a lot of business experience and is a hardworking, positive, and friendly woman.

Dashhuu is requesting a 5,000,000 MNT loan to purchase items for her clothing business.

loans.use: to purchase items and re-start her clothing business

loans.name: I Komang

texts.en:
I Komang is married with one boy and two daughters. He works buying and selling agricultural produce and runs his business with his children. I Komang purchases crops from farmers and then sells them at the market. When the harvest is close, he requires additional capital to purchase more crops from farmers. Farmers are happy to sell to I Komang because he pays them directly and they do not need to wait a day or two.

I Komang is requesting a loan to purchase paddies, coconut, cacao, banana, and other crops. He will collect all this produce with his children and then rent a car to transport his crops to the market. In the future, I Komang hopes to buy a car to use in his business.

loans.use: to purchase paddies, coconut, cacao, banana, and other crops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy embroidery material for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Aaron

texts.en: Aaron used his first loan to buy energy-efficient firewood stoves which he was able to successfully sell in less than a month. After this small and successful first loan was repaid to Kiva lenders just one month after they had made the loan, he is now looking to expand his business by buying twice as many stoves on credit.

loans.use: to pay for improved firewood cook stoves

loans.name: Jebaud Lestari Group

texts.en:
Like many Balinese women, Ni Kadek and the other members of the Jebaud Lestari group, raise pigs in their yards to supplement their families’ incomes.  Through many women support their families in this way, they may not know the best way to raise pigs to maximize their income. Ni Kadek hopes that, through the MUK pig breeder loan program, she will not only get capital but will also get training from MUK on the best way to feed and care for pigs.  

Ni Kadek is requesting a loan to purchase piglets and pig feed. She plans to sell the piglets after six months to be used as fattening pigs. Ni Kadek will use the profit from her loan to help support her family and supplement her husband's income. Ultimately, Ni Kadek hopes that increased income will enable her to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Lilia Susana

texts.es:
La cliente Lilia vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, ella comenzó vendiendo cosmético y perfumes de una revista conocida. poco a poco cuando pudo ahorra el capital suficiente comenzo con la venta de ropa ya que los clientes le hacían pedidos. 

En la actualidad trabaja de dos a tres horas en el día ya que tiene un hijo aun menor de edad y tiene que darle atención. La cliente tiene muchas aspiraciones para prosperar su negocio. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar para invertir en mercadería zapatos, ropa de hombres y mujer. En el futuro quiere tener un negocio grande y que su familia pueda disfrutar de los ingresos del negocio.
texts.en:
Lilia lives in a periurban area called Perimetral in Guayaquil.  She started selling cosmetics and perfume from a well-known catalog.  When she was able to gradually save enough capital, she started selling clothes because her customers were placing orders with her.

She now works two or three hours a day because she has a child who is a minor, and she has to care for him.  She has many aspirations for her business to prosper.

She wants to use the loan to buy merchandise like shoes and men’s and women’s clothing.

In the future she wants to have a large business and for her family to be able to enjoy the income from her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes and men’s and women’s clothing.

loans.name: Farhad

texts.en:
Farhad is 57 years old, married, and has a one son and five daughters. Farhad is an IDP (internally displaced person) who lives with his wife and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Jabrayili refugee. Farhad has bred cattle for last 30 years. After several attempts to find a job, he gave up and decided to start his own business. With the help of his wife, they purchased their first cattle.

Farhad usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and then sells them for a profit at the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 140 AZN and this business is the only source of financial income in his family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Farhad also keeps milk cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors. 

He has already taken 3 loans from Aqroinvest in the past. With a good loan history, he has applied for a fourth loan of 1800 AZN to purchase two cattle and one milk cow. With this money, he wants to expand his business and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle and one milk cow.

loans.name: Romnick

texts.en:
Romnick is a vegetable farmer from Bohol, Philippines. He is a married man and has been in the farming business for more than 2 years now.

Romnick is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides. Through this loan he will be able to improve his farm, as well as his harvest, thus allowing him to sell more vegetables at the market. 

In the future, Romnick dreams of making his business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Roque está en su primer ciclo, donde las miembros de este grupo se han unido para trabajar juntas, ayudar a sus familias y también a su comunidad, ya que son de un lugar un poco alejado de la ciudad, el cual es de difícil acceso, y no tienen acceso a muchos medios de comunicación.
Irene es una persona humilde, que con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo está saliendo adelante, su meta es poder ayudar a su familia y que no les falte nada, y no tengan que pasar por necesidades como las que ella tuvo que pasar, por medio de la venta de prendas está ayudando a los suyos y quiere seguir haciéndolo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de invierno para la venta, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
San Roque Group is in its first loan cycle.  The members of this group have gathered to work together and help their families and their communities.  They're from a place that's somewhat far from the city, which is difficult to get to and they don't have access to many means of communication.

Irene is a modest person who is getting ahead with a lot of work and effort.  Her goal is to be able to help her family so they lack nothing and don't have to suffer the hardships she did.  By selling clothing she's helping her family, and she wants to continue doing so.

She's requesting this loan to be able to invest in buying winter clothing to sell so she can continue working and fulfilling her customers' requests.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.en:
Mubariz is 52 years old, married, and the father of four children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) who lives with his wife and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Mubariz is a Jabrayili refugee. For more than 25 years, he has been growing fruit and vegetables. Mubariz plants tomatoes, potatoes, eggplant, and other crops to sell at the local bazaar. Even though his business is very hard, Mubariz and his wife have been working without any difficulty. He earns 50 AZN. 

Mubariz is requesting a 2,000 AZN loan through Agroinvest to buy fertilizer and seed to grow more vegetables and fruit. His loan will help increase his revenue and provide for his family's needs. In the future, Mubariz hopes to get more land to cultivate.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en:
Emilio used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children. 

He is a 42-year-old married man with eight children, living in Kasese, Uganda. He sells eggs and has been in the business for two years. Since the eggs are so delicate he sometimes loses a great many during transportation, so he desires to rent out a business premise to operate from. He has more dreams, such as educating his children and having a poultry project.

Emilio intends to use the loan to buy eggs to sell.

loans.use: to buy eggs to sell.

loans.name: Reyson

texts.en:
Reyson is 23 years old and married with one child. Being a responsible father, he works hard every day to generate income so that he can cover his daily costs. He is dedicated to a farming business, growing rice on his own land. In order to contribute to improving his family's living standards he has worked hard from early morning till late evening for years. 

He would like to develop his business, which is why he is asking for a loan in the amount of Php 22,000 to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season.

location.town: San Pedro San Pablo, Aurora, Isabela

loans.name: Douglas

texts.es: Douglas se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 5 años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz y el sorgo, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo de 8 meses, Douglas  está solicitando un crédito para poder comparar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y así poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en:
Douglas has worked in agriculture for 5 years now, an experience that has given him the required abilities and knowledge to tend to his crops. His main crops are corn and sorghum. He sells the harvests to agencies that buy and sell dry grains near his place of residence. With the profits he makes from the sales he helps out with family expenses. He lives with his wife and their 8-month old child in their own house. 

Douglas is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies that will help him plant his crops. These include: manure, seeds, and fertilizers. This will enable him to increase his earnings and to continue helping with household expenses without any difficulty.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Anaxanim

texts.en:
Anaxanim is 45 years old, and she has four children. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Jabrayil and lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. 

Anaxanim has bred cattle for the last 10 years. She usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then sells them for a profit in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 300 AZN, and this business is her only source of income. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Anaxanim also keeps milk cows for personal use and to sell milk to her neighbors.  

She wants to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family. She has applied for a 1,900 AZN loan to purchase two cattle and one milk cow. This will be her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle and one milk cow.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 30-year-old hardworking man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is a bakery along side transport to boost his income. Lack of efficient transport means and poor roads damaged by rainy seasons are his major challenges. 

However, his plans are to buy a car to transport bread and expand his business to new areas. Patrick is requesting a loan to buy cooking oil, wheat flour and other ingredients to use in his business.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, wheat flour and other ingredients to use in his business.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a married woman and has children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees, rent, and transport.

For the past three years she has operated a clothes selling business, selling door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a hard-working man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is brickmaking along side a saloon business to boost his income. 

He is facing hardships from unpredictable weather changes, however, he has a vision of establishing a hardware business and educating his children to higher levels of learning. Charles is requesting a loan to buy firewood and iron sheets and to pay for labor to construct a sun shade.

loans.use: to buy firewood and iron sheets and to pay for labor to construct a sun shade.

loans.name: Agataha

texts.en:
Agataha is applying for a loan of $1000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is married and she has four children. She is 38 years old. 

She is running a garden and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as materials for the garden. 

She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for her garden.

loans.name: Jovenes En Accion Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de Jóvenes Emprendedores tuvo sus inicios en julio del año 2012, lleva el nombre de Jóvenes en Acción, cuenta con 9 integrantes, es un grupo muy responsable, tienen un excelente comportamiento de pago, participan en las reuniones de capacitación y son muy solidarios entre compañeros, agradecen a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad que brindan a los Jóvenes que tiene deseo de emprender, y de esa forma poder aportar en sus casas y ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las historias que se destaca es el de Luz con 16 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta ambulante desde hace 2 años, ella en compañia de su madre viaja todos los fines de semana a Ciudad del Este en donde recorre a pie la ciudad y sus compañias con sus productos para la venta. Ella quiere el día de mañana poder tener un local y no tener que recorrer kilómetros para tener un mejor ingreso.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de ropas y zapatos para que ella pueda venderlos y seguir con su meta.
texts.en:
This group of young entrepreneurs started in July 2012.  They're called Jóvenes en Acción and there are nine members.  They're a very responsible group with an excellent payment record.  They have training meetings and are very supportive with each other.  They're grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunities offered to young people who want to set up businesses so they can contribute at home and help their families.

One of the stories that stands out is Luz's.  She's 16 years old and has worked as a street vendor for two years.  She and her mother travel every weekend to Ciudad del Este, where they go around the city on foot together to sell their products.

She wants to have a space in the future so she doesn't have to travel many kilometers to have a better income.

She's requesting this loan to be able to invest in buying clothing and shoes to sell and continue with her goal.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a hard-working woman who does her best to help her family in terms of living standards. She operates an M-pesa (mobile money transfer) business. Her clients are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation and lack of enough cash for her business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to add M-pesa float (electronically stored value credits) to her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business, and she appreciates the support granted.

loans.use: to add M-pesa float (electronically stored value credits for mobile money transfer) to her business.

loans.name: Dembagnouman Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Dembagnouman est composé de quatre  femmes qui sont toutes mariées dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 35ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans dans la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens  de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font le petit commerce de l’arachide et du riz. 
Dans le but de consolider leur petit commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 7ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (2ème femme debout de la  gauche vers la droite) est une grande vendeuse d’arachide de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 150kg d’arachide. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit dans le quartier de Pelengana à Ségou à une clientèle composée d’hommes et  de femmes. Madame Fatoumata  compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25000 FCFA, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité et participe à la prise en charge   des enfants. Son ambition est de pérenniser son activité dans le partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’accroitre ses activités économiques.
texts.en:
The group Dembagnouman consists of four married women who belong to monogamous families. They average 35 years of age and four children each. They all live in the city of Segou (4th administrative region of Mali), and they know one another as neighbors and through ties of kinship. They sell groundnuts and rice.

To strengthen their activities, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is their seventh group loan cycle. 

Mrs. Fatoumata (2nd from the left) is a successful reseller of a wide variety of groundnuts. She will use her loan to buy 150 kg of groundnuts. She conducts her sales for cash and on credit in the district of Pelengana, in Segou, to a clientele composed of both men and women. 

Fatoumata expects to earn an average monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA, which will be used to invest in her activity and to help provide for her children. Her goal is to make her activity sustainable through her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to bolster her economic endeavors.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts for resale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 27 year-old single mother of two children living in Kasese, Uganda. For five years she has been selling cosmetics. With the proceeds she has been able to provide basic necessities to her family. The seasonal nature of the business affect her income. Sarah intends to use the loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

Her dreams are to set up a beauty parlor and educate her children up to the University.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a 32-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is transport, which he supplements with farming to boost his income. He faces hardships of unpredictable weather changes and high fuel costs. Like all good fathers he desires to educate his children up to the university and set up sustainable income generating activities for them.

Vincent is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle which he intends to hire out; the rider will be remitting to him 80% of the daily earnings.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita earns a living through her vegetable farming business in her place in Bohol, Philippines. She is a married woman and has been in the farming business for several years now. This is the source of her income. 

Tita is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides and nylon for  trellis making. Through this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest. Tita dreams of expanding her venture to augment her earnings from it.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides and nylon for trellis making

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is a married man and a father of four from Trinidad, Bohol. He has been engaged in a charcoal-making business for more than three years. This is the source of his income.

Alberto is asking for a loan to buy more wood and coconut shells for charcoal making. Through this, he will be able to make more charcoal and sell it in the market. Alberto dreams of exploring another venture to augment his income so that he can support his family, especially the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy more wood and coconut shells for charcoal making

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline operates a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she gives thanks to Yehu and Kiva at large.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 25-year-old hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is motorcycle-taxi driver and has been in the business for the last 5 years with the aim of earning a living. He has the hopes of starting up another business, in particular a video library, given the challenges of accidents and high cost of fuel. Julius intends to use the loan to buy another motorcycle which he will hire out to someone else who will be remitting 80% of the daily earnings to him.

loans.use: to buy a motorcyle.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 27-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is retail alongside sewing clothes to boost his income. He is facing hardships of limited capital, however, Julius has a vision of buying land in the town center of Fort Portal. Julius needs a loan to buy stock of sugar, salt, washing detergents and sewing materials for the businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock of sugar, salt, washing detergents and sewing materials for the businesses.

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Being single at the age of 46 did not hinder Marialyn to improve her way of living. She has been engaged in the selling of meat in the local market for the past 10 years. She usually generates a net income of PHP1,500 a day in this activity.

Wanting to improve her business and save for her future, Marialyn is requesting a loan amount of PHP50,000. She intends to utilize the amount for purchasing more chicken, meat, and pork to sell. With that she is positive that her income will increase. She is praying that her loan request will be approved.

loans.use: to buy more chicken meat and pork to sell in the market

loans.name: Rhyme

texts.en: Rhyme is a 25 year old and single, living in Dimaluna, Ozamiz City. She is a private employee rendering her job as a teller/cashier of a company earning a salary of 11,000 PHP a month. She has been working to support her family for three years. She has just joined GDMPC and is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to finance the enrollment of her sister. In the future, she dreams of having her own business to earn a better living.

loans.use: to finance enrollment of her sister

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married mother of four children, three of whom go to school; one has finished. They live at their rental house that has electricity  but no piped water. 

For five years, Mary has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. She dreams of establishing a cafe in the future. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase 6 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar for preparation of food. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 6 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar for preparation of food.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school and one is still young for school. She rents a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over one year, she has operated an open food business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and potatoes to prepare food for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and potatoes to prepare food for sale.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is a married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is engaged in a seaweed business together with her family. This is the source of their income. 

Benita is asking for a loan to buy nets for seaweed farming. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her seaweed farm as well as her harvest. Benita dreams of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy nets for seaweed farming

loans.name: Paola Andrea

texts.es:
Paola de 27 años de edad, considera que lo más importante en su vida es su familia y el bienestar de la misma es una de sus grandes prioridades. Labora en un centro comercial del municipio de Rionegro Antioquia, pero debido a la difícil condición económica en su hogar se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el fin de adquirir un carro para la venta de mangos, el cual administrará su tía, lo que le permitirá generar empleo y mejorar la economía en su hogar.
Sueña con convertirse en una empresaria de éxito por lo cual espera que este sea el primero de los muchos carros que desea distribuir por toda su localidad.
texts.en:
27-year-old Paola considers her family to be the most important thing in her life and ensuring their well-being is one of her highest priorities.  Paola works in a shopping mall in the town of Rionegro, Antioquia but, owing to the difficult financial situation in which her household finds itself, she is requesting a loan to buy a food cart from which to sell mango.  This business will be run by her aunt.  It will allow her to create work and improve her household's financial situation.

Paola dreams of becoming a successful businesswoman and hopes that this will be the first of many carts that she will have around town.

loans.use: to buy a food cart for selling mango

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Lucia  está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, el cual es un medio para conocer la situación de cada una de las miembros. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ellas se encuentran mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Maria es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas de todo tipo, cuenta que su negocio tiene muy buen éxito, ya que tiene muy buena clientela y también buena venta. Cuenta que los fines de semanas es cuando más ventas tiene. Por medio de este trabajo es que ella está ayudando a su familia y les da todo lo que necesitan para el día a día.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas de todo tipo, como ser cervezas, vinos, gaseosas, y demás, ya que por medio de esto podrá seguir invirtiendo en su plan de negocios y creciendo como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Santa Lucia Group is in its second loan cycle in the women's committee program.  They're taking the poverty-elimination survey to find out the poverty level of each member.  They're improving their situations through their effort and ongoing work, as well as by applying the vital behavior of a successful woman.

One of the group members is María.  She makes a living selling all types of beverages.  She says her business is very successful because she has very good customers as well as good sales.  She says she sells most on the weekend.  With this job she's helping her family and giving them everything they need on a daily basis.

She's requesting the loan to buy all types of beverages, such as beer, wine, soda, and others, because this way she'll be able to continue investing in her business plan and growing as a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy beer, wine, soda, and other beverages

loans.name: Besarion
