texts.en:
Besarion is 35 years old. He lives in a small village of Bolnisi District with his wife. Besarion requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from the agricultural activities. In particular, they have a pig and a hectare plot of land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. They sell the harvested vegetables at local markets. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Besarion requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Besarion has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Besarion will purchase bee-hives with bee-colonies. They will produce honey for him to sell and will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase bee-hives with bee-colonies

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita earns her income through her 'sari-sari' or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place in San Miguel, Bohol. This is the source of her income. 

Carmelita is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda. biscuits, snack foods and others. Through this, she will be able to buy more stock in bulk and attract more buyers to her store.

Carmelita is hopeful that one day she will be able to improve her store and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda. biscuits, snack foods and others

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a married mother of four children, three of whom attend school and one is still too young. She owns a house that has neither electricity  nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over ten years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and transportation to her place of business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Jon Rex

texts.en: Jon Rex is a 24-year-old living in Aguada, Ozamiz City. He has been an employee of a private company for three years, earning 10,000 PHP a month to support his family. He just joined GDMPC and has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase a transport vehicle to improve his transport business. In the near future, he plans to own a merchandise store in their village to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.en: Arsenio is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol in the Philippines. He is a married man and has two grown children. Arsenio has been in the farming business for more than 30 years now. This is the source of his income. Arsenio is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through this, he will be able to improve his farm as well as his harvest. He wants to make his farm a stable source of his income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman from San Miguel, Bohol. She has been engaged in a food vending business for more than five years now. She sells home cooked snack foods like fried bananas and others. This is her source of income. Her husband works as a carpenter. 

Cristina is asking for a loan to buy more bananas, flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her food vending business. With these, she will be able to cook and sell more, thus increasing her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her food vending business

loans.name: Adeltrodez

texts.en: Adeltrodez, 64, is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental int he Philippines. She is owns and manages a retail store (sari-sari) selling grocery in the local community. She earns PHP 8,000 a month from the business, which she has been running for 15 years. In 2008, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services and is currently requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 for additional capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu operates a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business and she dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 30,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans,cooking fat and rice. She appreciates the help given to her.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, cooking fat and rice.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. She has one child and has been doing this work (agriculture) for eight years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, transportation services, and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Earning from agriculture to meet family needs' Her biggest challenge is 'Access to funds.' An animal on the farm has been given the name of 'Cheptil.'

Magdaline was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Joined Juhudi Kilimo after seeing members from another group benefit from Juhudi Kilimo.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Was taught how to manage funds in agriculture like record keeping.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Magdaline replied 'Will generate more income through value addition of agricultural product.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Magdaline owns the following: 'cow, poultry, motorcycle' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, TV' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: To purchase a 'posho' (cornmeal) mill

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a married mother whose children still attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the children.

For the past years, she has operated a fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and other town-dwellers. She faces a major challenge of high transportation cost in her place of operation. 

Juliana is requesting for a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Nashiferije

texts.en:
As you can see in the photograph, Nashiferije has been operating a variety type of store for the past three years. She sells various items and serves little snacks and coffees. Her plans for the future are to expand the services by running a larger store, but for now she is only looking to buy some items for her inventory. 

"The activity has not been that bad and I have enjoyed my work, but it can be better," Nashiferije said.

Nashiferije is married and has two school-aged children. They live in a small town in the south-central part of the country. In the past she has worked with Social Assistance projects offering meals to the poor.

loans.use: To buy inventory items for her variety store

loans.name: Pierson Uliese

texts.es:
Pierson, 45 años de edad, habitante de la ciudad de Managua, casado, madre de hijos. El se dedica a la venta de carne y queso. Su primera experiencia fue con la venta de queso de manera ambulante posteriormente agrego la venta de carne de res y cerdo. El sale a vender a zonas cercanas de la ciudad, pulperías y en su vecindario.
Él está necesitando el crédito para comprar cerdos y queso para vender. Uno de sus proyectos darle mantenimiento a su camioneta la cual utiliza para transportar su producto pues esta algo vieja y necesita en tenerla en buenas condiciones para movilizarse más rápidamente y darle y mejor servicio a su clientela.
texts.en:
Pierson, 45, lives in the city of Managua and is married to the mother of his children.  He makes a living selling meat and cheese.

His first experience was selling cheese as a street vendor.  Later he added beef and pork.  He goes out to make sales in areas near the city, in convenience stores, and in his neighborhood.

He needs the loan to buy pigs and cheese to sell.

One of his projects is to do maintenance on the truck he uses to transport his product because it's slightly old and it needs to be in good condition so he can get around quickly and give his customers better service.

loans.use: to buy pigs and cheese

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina, de 54 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo en su casa propia, la cual compró hace 30 años aproximadamente.Desde hace 29 años, cuando comenzó a formar su familia aprendió a negociar los cereales que siembran en su ciudad, desde entonces tiene clientes y amistades en otras ciudades, donde comercializa sus alimentos. “Tengo muchos clientes, paso la mayor parte del día en la ciudad de Lima, pues el trabajo no me permite regresar con frecuencia a mi casa”, afirma. Es por esa razón que continúa con la comercialización de sus alimentos. Espera poder enseñar todo su conocimiento a su  hija, para poder descansar y dedicarse a sus animales que es su otra actividad económica.Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA, agradece el apoyo financiero recibido ya que puede administrar su dinero y volverlo productivo. Además le gusta mucho el trabajo con su banco comunal, por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Paulina, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de cereales y animales por cantidad para su venta en otras ciudades.
texts.en: Paulina is 54 years old and is a hardworking woman.  She lives with her husband  in a home of her own, which she bought about 30 years ago.  Ever since she began forming her family at age 29, she learned to work with the cereal grains she raises in town.  Since then she has developed clients and friends in other cities where she sells her foodstuff.  “I have many customers, I spend most of my time in Lima, but my work does not allow me to return home often,” she says.  This is why she continues selling her foodstuff.  She hopes to be able to teach everything to her daughter, so that she can rest and dedicate her efforts to her animals and her other financial activities.  This will be her second loan through Kiva and she is grateful for the financial backing that she has gotten because she is able to manage her money and reinvest it.  She also likes working with her communal bank and she promises to me on time with her payments.  Paulina will use the 3,000 PEN to buy cereals and animals in quantity to sell in other cities.

loans.use: to buy animals and grains.

loans.name: Jala

texts.en:
Jala is 20 years old. She is a mother of one daughter. Jala is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Jabrayil and lives with her husband and daughter in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Jala is a very hardworking woman. For the past year, she has been raising chickens and is very active in poultry. She usually buys small chickens, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then sells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her husband also helps her in this business because it is the only income for their family. From this business Jala's monthly income is 120 AZN.

In Azerbaijan chicken is in very high demand because people use it in everyday dishes like levengi, chicken soup, tabaca, kabab, etc. Jala sells chicken eggs too. People eat chicken eggs every day for breakfast. In one day, she sells approximately 50 eggs.

Jala has already taken three loans from Aqroinvest in the past. With a good loan history, she has applied for her fourth loan of 1,800 AZN. With this money, she wants to invest in the business and buy more small chickens in order to generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy small chickens

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is taking out a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy items to keep in her store such as rice, detergent, noodles and biscuits. She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $500.  Josefina is a hard working woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy, rice, detergent, noodles and biscuits

loans.name: Viktori

texts.en:
Viktori is a married Egyptian Albanian and mother of two whose ambition is to feel equal to others.

“Coming from a vulnerable community, it is very difficult because you are struggled with your identity and the stigma that comes with it, and unfortunately, the majority of my community members have suffered from this. While some of us have found opportunities and have improved our lives these past twenty something years, the rest of us continue to struggle in many ways. And I just want to leave behind the identity and the stigma, the financial and educational struggle and move on but... ” Viktori said, looking down.

Viktori is a seamstress and is requesting this loan to purchase raw fabric materials.

loans.use: To buy raw fabric materials.

loans.name: Miller

texts.es: Miller, de 20 años de edad es un joven trabajador. Vive con su esposa Estela desde hace medio año en una casa alquilada. “La facilidad del riego hace que nuestros sembríos sean de buena calidad y nuestra cercanía con la carretera central que los precios sean altos”, afirma. Como buen agricultor analiza las razones de su éxito, pues desde joven comenzó a negociar con los terrenos que sus padres le heredaron, desde niño aprendió lo necesario y ahora que decidió formar una familia espera mejorar sus ingresos para adquirir todo lo que necesita. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, cebada y habas, además gracias a su trabajo constante ya compró una vaca de calidad, con ello espera dedicarse también a la ganadería. Como es un hombre responsable todavía no tiene hijos, pues tiene como meta comprar una casa en la ciudad para educarlos.Este es el segundo crédito con Kiva y está muy agradecido con el apoyo financiero brindado motivo por el cual se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Miller, invertirá los S/. 1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Miller is 20 years old and is a hardworking young man.  He lives with his wife, Estela, in a rented home and has for a year and a half.  "The ease of irrigation makes our crops of good quality and our nearness to the central road keeps the prices low," he says.  Like a good farmer, he analyzes his reason for success.  When he was very young he learned to work with his land that he inherited from his parents.  Now that he decided to form a family of his own, he hopes to improve his income so he can acquire all he needs.  His main crops are potatoes, barley, and peas.  Thanks to his constant work he has already bought a good cow.  With this he also hopes to begin raising livestock.  Because he is a responsible man, he doesn't have any children yet, but his goal is to buy a good house so he can provide them with an education.  This will be his second Kiva loan and he is very grateful with the financial support and he is committed to being on time with his payments.  Miller will use the 1,000 PEN to buy compost to feed his crops.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad has been engaged in rice farming and hog raising for more than 19 years. She is a married woman and lives with her family in San Miguel, Bohol. This is the source of her income.

Felicidad is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and feed for the pigs. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her farm and her piggery, which will allow her to earn more and save more to reinvest in her business and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en:
Parviz is 27 years old and the father of two children. He is  an IDP (internally displaced person) from Jabrayil and lives with his wife and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Parviz has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than five years now. He is very hardworking and passionate in his   work. He considers it fun to grow potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers and plant fruit trees with his wife. He sells his crops in the central bazaar for making profits in order to support his family. 

Parviz's income from the business is 80 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat). In order to improve the living conditions of his family, he plans to expand his business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. He believes in the near future, he will grow the business bigger. Since the vegetable and fruit business is profitable and a fun business, he wants the business to continue and prosper.

He has applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN at Aqroinvest. This loan is for the purpose of getting new fertilizers and seeds. It will help him to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to get more revenue in the coming summer, which will help him to support his family’s needs.

loans.use: to get new fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Gjergji

texts.en:
A loan of 70,000 Albanian Lek (ALL) would be of great help for this Egyptian Albanian who lives in a village in south-central Albania. Gergji, who is in his early thirties, is married and has two young children. He sells items including clothes, home decorations and housewares/kitchenware, etc., at the market and he is happy so far with the progress of his activity and the income. 

“I started the buying/selling activity of new items almost three years ago, and I have been doing very well. Clients like my items, and they buy them, and I am very grateful,” Gjergji said. “I need to buy some more items to resell with this loan and since I have been told that my profile will be published on Kiva, I hope lenders will help me,” Gjergji ended. 

Kindly note that Gjergji has been photographed here with some of the items he resells.

loans.use: To buy housewares and clothing to resell.

loans.name: Yenny Narcisa

texts.es:
La clienta vive en Guayaquil.  Tiene más de 10 años  en el negocio de confección, esta actividad la aprendió de su mamá. Lo realiza todos los días con una de sus hijas desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00.

La dificultad que ella tiene es la enfermedad que tiene en las piernas, que no le permite movilizarse a diferentes sectores de la ciudad.

Está separada del esposo, tiene 3 hijos los cuales estudian en escuela fiscal. Su sueño es tener un negocio formal de ropa detrás de su vivienda, en lo familiar que sus hijos se preparen. Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas e hilo para poder confeccionar mas ropa.
texts.en:
This client lives in Guayaquil.   She’s been in the clothes making business for more than ten years; she learned this activity from her mother.  She works every day from 8am until 6pm with one of her daughters.  The difficulty she has is the disease in her legs that keeps her from being able to get around to various parts of the city.

She’s separated from her husband and has three children attending public school.  Her dream is to have a formal clothes selling business behind her house and her personal wish is that her children become prepared.  She wants to use the loan to buy fabric and thread to make more clothes.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for community health work and taxi business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for community health work and taxi business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for community health work and taxi business

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргиза умелый продавец. Она умеет привлекать клиентов на свой товар. У неё десять лет опыта в сфере торговли и за это время сумела научиться всем тонкостям купли продажи товаров. Её товар состоит из обуви – масса обуви и галош. По словам самой Наргизы, данный момент сезон продажи летных тапочек и ей приходится часто и быстро обновить свой товар. И действительно, когда подошла к её лавке, не смогла толком посмотреть на её товар, так как там было полно покупателей (но нужно подчеркнуть, что не все кто смотрели, покупали обувь).  По словам Наргизы секрет такого числа клиентов и продаж заключается в цене её товаров.  Она привозит обувь и галоши сама, поэтому и продаёт их, немного дешевле остальных. Наргиза не имеет высшее образование, но отлично справляется с делами  в бизнес - сфере. Имеет троих любящих детей. Муж помогает в деле торговли. Дети учатся в школе и университете.  В связи с сезонностью Наргиза нуждается в дополнительных деньгах. Желает не упустить  «золотое» время и привозит товар, пока имеется большой спрос на них. Но не имеет свободных денег. С этой целью обратилась в ООО МДО «Арванд» за кредитом. Заранее благодарить за помощь и содействие в продвижении её дела.
texts.en: Nargiza is a skilled salesperson.  She is able to attract customers to her merchandise.  She has ten years of experience in the retail field and was able to learn all of the nuances of buying and selling merchandise during this time.  Her merchandise consists of shoes - a lot of shoes and galoshes.  According to Nargiza's own words, now is the season for selling summer slippers and she has to update her merchandise often and quickly.  And truly, when coming to her store, one could not look at her merchandise in detail because there were a lot of customers (but it is necessary to point out that not all who looked were buying shoes).  According to Nargiza's words, the secret to such a number of clients and sales is in the prices of her goods.  She brings in shoes and galoshes herself and this is why sells them slightly cheaper than others.  Nargiza does not have a higher education, but handles business affairs perfectly.  She has three loving children.  Her husband helps her with the sales business.  The children attend a school and a university.  Due to the season, Nargiza needs additional money.  She does not want to miss out on the "golden" time and brings in merchandise while there is high demand for it, but does not have available funds.  She came to MDO "Arvand" for a loan with this goal in mind.  She is grateful in advance for the help and assistance in advancing her business.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Sevinc

texts.en:
Sevinc is 27 years old and the mother of two children. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and kids in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She is a Jabrayili refugee.  She is very kind, caring and also very energetic in her work. 

Sevinc is growing fruits and vegetables. She plants tomatoes, potatoes, eggplants and other vegetables and fruits. She says even though this business is very hard, together with her husband she has been handling the business for three years without any difficulty. 

Sevinc grows vegetables and fruits and sells them in the bazaar. Her income from vegetable and fruit sales is 150 AZN. She has more plans for the future, such as to get more land for cultivation. Sevinc is looking forward to increased sales in the coming summer because people purchase fruits a lot.

She has applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN from Aqroinvest. This loan is for the purpose of getting new fertilizers and seeds. It will help Sevinc to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to get more revenue in the coming summer, which will help her to support her family’s needs.

loans.use: to get new fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the farming venture for more than 15 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Felicitas is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. With this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest. 

In the future, Felicitas dreams of expanding her farm so that it will generate more income necessary for their daily needs, like foods and to pay their bills.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Xhidije

texts.en:
Xhidije is a 57-year-old villager and a mother of six; some of her children are continuing going to school. They live in south-central Albania. Until the age of 35, Xhidije worked in livestock farming, called a “Cooperative” back in the Communist era.

Xhidije’s activity for the past ten years has been in selling fresh dairy produce to the market. She has dairy cows, and this is where she gets the milk to make dairy products, cheese/cottage cheese and yogurt. Dairy is considered a staple food throughout the country and especially in the rural areas, where almost every family makes its own. 

Xhidije is now requesting a loan to buy another milk cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from San Miguel, Bohol. She has been engaged in a seaweed farming business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her income.

Gloria is asking for a loan to buy more straw and seaweed seedlings. Through this loan, she will be able to improve the farm as well as the harvest. Moreover, she dreams of expanding her business so that it will generate more income necessary for the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more straw and seaweed seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for community health work and taxi business

loans.name: Shakir

texts.en:
Shakir is 45 years old and a father of five children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Jabrayil and lives with  his wife and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.  

Shakir has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than twenty years now.  He is very hard-working and passionate in his work.  He considers it fun to grow potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers and plant fruit trees with his wife.  He sells his crops in the central bazaar to make profits in order to support his family. 

Shakir's income from his business is 130 AZN.  In order to increase the living conditions of his family, he plans to expand his business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort.  Shakir believes that in the near future his sons will help him to grow the business bigger. Since the vegetable and fruit business is profitable and a fun business, he wants the business to continue and prosper.

Shakir has applied for a loan of 2000 AZN at Aqroinvest. This loan is for the purpose of getting new fertilizers and seeds. It will help him to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to get more revenue in the coming summer, which will help him to support his family’s needs.

loans.use: to get new fertilizers and seeds for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Dagoberto

texts.es: Dagoberto  de 33 años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo,  tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la agricultura por lo que se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en el rubro, es muy conocido en la zona y ya tiene buena clientela pues obtiene las mejores cosechas, por lo tanto comercia producto de primera calidad y a precios muy accesibles, además el servicio es inigualable, en la última siembra no obtuvo las ganancias esperadas y esta vez quiere aumentar la producción, pero necesita de un apoyo de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, abonos, herbicidas y fertilizantes, confía que podrá responder a la deuda y al mismo tiempo podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Dagoberto, 33, lives with his life companion and their two children.  He works growing corn and sorghum.  He’s worked in agriculture for many years so has gained much experience in this line of work.  He’s very well-known in the zone and has a good clientele because he obtains good harvests.  Because of this, he sells top quality products at very affordable prices; besides service is unequaled.

He did not get the expected profits from his previous harvest so he wants to enlarge production this time around but needs capital support which is why he’s asking Integral for a loan to be able to buy seeds, manure, herbicide and fertilizer.   He trusts that he’ll be able to repay the loan while at the same time providing his family with a full life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, herbicide, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Jossue Jeremias

texts.es: Jossue de 32 de  años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa e hijo. Él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, y es la única forma que conoce de cómo ganarse la vida. Es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado y responsable. A pesar de las condiciones en las que vive, las cuales son muy humildes no se cansa de trabajar y de dar lo mejor a su familia. Es un hombre luchador. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito  para comprar los principales insumos agrícolas: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, etc.  que es la razón por la cual solicita este crédito.  Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
Jossue, 32, lives in a house that’s his property with his wife and son.  He works growing corn and beans.  This is how he earns a living and is able to provide his home’s daily bread.  Growing crops is a year to year activity and the only way he knows of earning a living.  He’s a very hardworking, honest and responsible man.  Despite the conditions he lives in which are very humble, he does not tire of working and of providing the best for his family.  He’s a fighter.

He’s decided to request a loan to buy the main farm supplies: manure, insecticide, seeds, etc.  This is the reason behind the loan request.  He hopes to get positive results because he has no other source of income.  He trusts in God that he’ll get an abundant crop yield that will make it possible for him to continue providing daily bread for his home.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is 26 years old. He lives in Akhalkalaki district with his 21-year-old wife and an infant child. Artur requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Artur is an artisan who works on private orders in the factories. His wife bakes cakes for birthdays. They both earn a small monthly income, which is rarely enough for food for the family. 

Artur requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Artur has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Artur wants to start canned meat production. His father-in-law gave him canned meat-producing equipment. They have a small commercial space, where Artur plans to start a business. He will purchase raw materials and jars; also print the labels and renovate the space to prepare it as a small factory. 

Artur is very hardworking man, and he wants to use the chance his father-in-law gave to him and start a new family business to increase his monthly income and provide a better future for his child.

loans.use: to start producing canned meat.

loans.name: Altanchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs Altanchimeg, 53-years-old, lives with her husband and children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. 

Mrs Altanchimeg has been working as a senior chef at a restaurant for five years. Her husband has been teaching driving skills to local people since 2010. 

The house they live in has been deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair. So Mrs Altanchimeg is requesting a loan of 2,300,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, fibreglass and foam. Using these materials, she and her husband will repair and make insulation to their house thus making their home more comfortable and a warmer place. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, emit less smoke and then contribute to the efforts against air pollution. 

The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en: Riza is 41-years-old, with eight children.  She lives in Canibungan Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To support the income of her husband from farming, she manages a transport services earning PHP 7,000 a month.  In 2010, she became a member of GDMPC and is currently requesting a loan of PHP 13,500 PHP to repair their transport motorcycle for better services. She always dreams to increase their income for better living conditions in the near future.

loans.use: to repair a transport motorcycle used in her business.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey has been involved in agriculture for two years. He cultivates rice. Sales of agricultural products give Jeffrey an income that is hardly enough for covering the family's costs.  His family consists of his wife and himself.  

As agriculture helps Jeffrey to maintain a stable income during the month and sustain his family, he would like to enlarge his agricultural business. He has requested a loan amounting PHP 21,000 to pay for fertilizer and cover cultivation costs.

Jeffrey hopes that the loan will help him to earn a higher income, and he will be able to ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and cover cultivation costs.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a 54-year-old, married woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods, most especially milled rice. 

Juana is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, and rice. Through this loan, she will be able to sell more and improve her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, and rice.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is engaged in retail sales of bananas, sweet potatoes and other crops to the people in her home area in San Miguel. She is a married woman and has been in the business for more than five years now. This is the source of her family income. 

Leonida is asking for a loan to buy more bananas, sweet potatoes and other crops to sell. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her business and makes it a success.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, sweet potatoes and other crops to sell.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge de 37 años de edad, tiene una tienda  en el municipio de San Jacinto, donde habita con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 12 a 15 años. Mediante la observación encontró deficiencias de productos de la canasta familiar, en el sector donde hoy se encuentra su tienda y aprovechando un local desocupado decidió dar respuesta a esa necesidad del mercado de sus vecinos. Jorge antes de iniciar con la tienda  en este barrio, estuvo ubicando el mejor espacio comercial para hacerlo, por eso le dio resultado cuando trasladó su negocio del lugar donde no prosperaba. Su negocio hoy, tiene 4 años y su meta es continuar persistiendo en su crecimiento. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará artículos de la canasta familiar  como arroz, aceite, azúcar, café, etc. Con ello planea incrementar sus ventas y hacer de su credikiva la mejor inversión del periodo.
texts.en:
Jorge, 37, has a store in the town of San Jacinto where he lives with his wife and three children aged 12 to 15 years.  He observed that basic staples were hard to get in the sector where his store is now located.  He took advantage of a vacant locale and decided to meet this market need for his neighbors.

Prior to opening the store in this neighborhood, Jorge looked for the best possible location for it which is why it produced good results when he moved it from where it hadn’t been doing too well.  To date, his store has been in operation for four years and his goal is to continue persisting in its growth.

This is the reason behind his Kiva loan request, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that he’ll use to buy basic staple items like rice, oil, sugar, coffee, etc.  He plans thus to increase sales and make his Kiva loan the best investment of the period.

loans.use: to buy basic staples to stock his store.

loans.name: Sila

texts.es:
Sila, de 18 años es una joven trabajadora. Vive en compañía de sus padres a los que quiere mucho. 
Ella es una joven luchadora, desde pequeña aprendió a trabajar en el campo y Ccando cumplió la edad adecuada, comenzó a ayudar a su hermana en los trabajos de administración de los terrenos que heredaron de parte de sus padres, quienes confiaron de la sabiduría que posee. Es por esa razón que desea mejorar su capital de trabajo para poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos. “Comenzaré con poco capital de trabajo, pues ya quiero ser independiente y producir en mis propios terrenos, comenzaré con la avena, en esta temporada tiene mucha demanda”, afirma. Esta segura que comenzará con éxito esta etapa en su vida.Este es el primer crédito con Kiva y agradece la oportunidad brindada para crecer como persona.Sila, invertirá los S/.300 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Sila, 18 years old, is a hardworking youth.  She lives with her parents, and loves them very much.

She is a fighter.  She has been learning to work in the country since she was a child, and when she was old enough she started helping her sister with work in the land that they inherited from their parents, who shared the wisdom they possess.  Because of this, she wishes to improve her working capital to  be able to increase their income.  "I will begin with little working capital, and since I want to be independent and produce on my own land I will begin with oats. It is in demand during this season," affirms Sila.  This will ensure that she will begin this phase of her life successfully.  This is her first loan with Kiva and she is thankful for the opportunity offered to grow as a person.  Sila will invest 300 soles in buying organic fertilizer to nourish her seedlings.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.
